data.contentHTML:
Become a Senior Software Developer with CYARA.


Who is Cyara?

Cyara is the world’s leading Automated CX Assurance Platform provider, enabling leading brands across the globe to build better customer experiences faster. Through automated testing and monitoring, Cyara accelerates the delivery of flawless customer journeys across digital and voice channels while reducing the risk of customer-facing defects. Every day,the most recognizable brands, including Airbnb, Tesla, Google and NAB trust Cyara to deliver customer smiles at scale.
Our promise is Customer Smiles. Delivered at Scale, and as a member of Cyara’s team, you’ll be given the opportunity to bring that mission to fruition alongside our amazing community of fun-loving forward thinkers.


The Opportunity:

Our Melbourne software development team is hiring a Senior Software Developer (Full Stack) to be involved with the development of a number of exciting software applications for our Product Roadmap.

You will be involved in the complete software lifecycle support working with Angular and .NET technologies. Experience in or a desire to learn about telephony and contact centre technologies is advantageous for this role


To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • Experience with .NET Technologies (.NET Core is plus)
  • Advanced experience with Angular and/or Typescript
  • Experience with OOP, preferably C# , .NET MVC
  • Good understanding of Databases, preferably experience with Microsoft SQL Server
  • Understanding of ORM tools such as Entity Framework and Dapper
  • Emphasis on high-quality code with excellent test coverage and code reviews
  • Team player, familiar with Agile methodologies
  • Experience using microservices architectures
  • Experience working with CI/CD pipelines and practices

What You’re Looking For:

With this opportunity comes the chance to enjoy a flexible work environment, working with a global, all-inclusive team of innovators. We credit our amazing growth and success on the fact that we’ve built our business on four essential values that we live and breathe every day:

Customer Obsession. We pride ourselves on our customer focus and commitment of our team. Their dedication and relentless effort to hold our customer’s hand throughout their journey until favorable outcomes have been delivered.

Innovation. Don’t be afraid to bring new ideas, thinking, and approaches to Cyara and question our existing approach, as we believe in constant learning and continuous improvement. We take pride in doing things that have never been done before, no matter how impossible they may seem.

Humility. At Cyara we’ve worked hard to build a flat, team-centric culture where everyone rolls their sleeves up to get the job at hand done even if it’s not in your job description. No task is too small for all of us to do. Be confident yet humble.

Quality. Always put in your best effort and the results will take care of themselves! We don’t compromise the quality of your work even though time pressures may exist.

data.contentHTML:
Express your interest in Sourcing/Buying/Category/Commercial Manager Roles with a leader in Australian eCommerce!

About The Opportunities

We are always on the hunt for the best and brightest talent for our Sourcing/Buying/Category Management Commercial roles - do you think you have what it takes? We would love to hear from you...Express your interest now!

Our Import and Buying teams play a crucial role in our business. They source the best quality products to ensuring that we have the latest and most in-demand products available and ready to delight customers.

Our sourcing teams focus on key areas including:
  • Exclusive Brands/Private Label Team play an integral part of our product range - after all, this is how our business started! The team select the most relevant products, working with suppliers and product testers to bring the most relevant products to market at the best value price.
  • Import - Global Brands Team seek out and source all the items we directly import to our customers from suppliers across the world. They negotiate the best deals to pass on savings to our customers. You will be working on exciting new brands, getting the latest, greatest and trending products for our customers!
  • Partner Brands Team responsible for the sourcing of globally recognised brand name products directly from the manufacturer. Sourcing the best deals available for our customers and ensuring we have a suitable range of the latest and greatest products in the market
  • Kogan Marketplace Team is responsible for delivering the Kogan Marketplace offering to our customers including the onboarding of new sellers with the ability to offer their goods to the Kogan Community, therefore providing another channel for the most in demand, quality and affordable products to our customers. Our team fosters and grows relationships with our sellers as a key success factor.
Your passion for the eCommerce world of retail and technology will be glaringly obvious, and you’ll use that passion to drive our product selection.

The online retail market is fast-paced and constantly evolving, so being able to quickly react to changes in demand and market trends is essential for success.

The Roles

You will need to be prepared to manage the end-to-end supply chain for our products including:
  • Market research and analysis
  • Demand determination
  • Identifying trending in-demand products
  • Building relationships with manufacturers, suppliers and vendors.
  • Negotiating commercial outcomes
  • Assisting with the development of marketing strategies
  • Ensuring timely import of products and stock management
You should be/have:
  • Previous experience in a highly commercial role such as a Buyer or Category Manager in the retail (or similar) sector - for Exclusive Brands roles - bonus points if you’ve had exposure to Private Label product sourcing before
  • University Degree qualified in a relevant field (commerce, analytics, maths, accounting, IT, buying, etc)
  • Highly analytical and ready to delve into data - being able to evaluate offers and products quickly to determine if they’re of value to our customers is key
  • Excellent commercial and business acumen to make key commercially savvy decisions
  • A strong negotiator who’s ready to fight for the best commercial outcomes so that we can offer market leading pricing to our customers
  • A multi-tasking ninja - we expect you to juggle 50 different tasks at once without dropping the ball (we’re not kidding)
  • A whiz with Microsoft Excel (we’re talking VLOOKUP, Index Matching, pivot tables, advanced formulas, macros - and we will test your capabilities)
  • Tech savvy and ability to use various IT and cloud-based tools to improve efficiency and productivity
  • Ready to challenge, be challenged, and work within our highly disruptive business model
What’s on offer:
Our culture is high-performance one and we’ve got a lot to offer! We are on a mission to make products and services more affordable and accessible and our work is very rewarding. We can guarantee you’ll be challenged and at times, pushed out of your comfort zone, challenging the status quo and learning as a consequence! You’ll be working on things that are new and exciting with a bunch of talented fellow team members.

We work hard, play hard and we are big fans of keeping active including getting involved in various marathons, soccer and other competitions. We have onsite yoga classes, table tennis competitions (we take it very seriously!), FIFA championships, Daytona and many other games! On top of that, you will also have access to the latest gadgets and tech, alongside other benefits offered within the company as well as by our external partners.

Sound like you? Awesome, we can’t wait to meet you!

Think you have what it takes to be part of Team Kogan.com?

Express your interest in this opportunity by uploading a cover letter with your application that describes your previous experience, what you are passionate about and how you think you can help grow the Kogan business.

Applications that show a deep knowledge of the Kogan.com business and how we operate will be looked upon more favourably.

Heads up!
  • Kogan.com is a fast-paced business - our vacancy close dates are subject to change. We will assess applications as they are received, so don't wait to apply!
  • All new Kogan.com team members are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.

data.contentHTML:
About Us

UniSuper is one of Australia’s largest superannuation funds and is run solely for the benefit of its members. For more than 34 years, UniSuper has been managing super for people employed in the higher education and research sector. UniSuper currently invests around $85 billion on behalf of 450,000 current and former higher education and research employees.

The Opportunity

We’re all here to help deliver greater retirement outcomes for our members. Your role supports UniSuper doing this by contributing to multiple layers of application development, from core infrastructure and back-end, to its custom front-end. Developing and designing web architecture, ensuring the responsiveness of integrated applications, uplift of the user experience, and delivering development solutions from conception to final product.

Key responsibilities will include: -

  • Participating in our product development from ideation to deployment and beyond
  • Designing, coding, code reviews, testing and installing applications, in a range of applications across multiple platforms
  • Providing design input to the Discovery process in the very early phase of new features
  • Contributing towards CI/CD (DevOps)
  • Preparing and maintaining systems, and application documentation that’s easily understood by other users.
  • Assisting in the analysis and design of applications, databases and servers.
  • Proactively reporting opportunities to troubleshoot applications aiming to reduce cycle times and go beyond expectations.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will possess some of the following experiences and traits: -

  • Have a Tertiary qualification or equivalent degree
  • Possess strong experience in Programming and Applications Design, and general IT experience
  • Have demonstrable hands-on experience creating public, complex systems using multiple languages
  • Be experienced in multiple relevant programming languages e.g.: C#.Net, ASP.Net MVC, .NET APIs, Sitecore, Angular or other SPA frameworks
  • Use your experience in - Azure, .NET Core, BizTalk, Android/ios mobile development, and harness your skills and knowledge of relational and NoSQL database technology such as MySQL, Oracle and MongoDB.


What We Offer

A challenging, collaborative and fun culture. You will receive the support that you need to build your own career in a Delivery Enablement team that is leading delivery of solutions right across UniSuper.

You’ll also receive extra annual leave days between Christmas and New Year, access to a Wellness program, volunteer leave, generous superannuation contributions, gym discounts and support for flexibility. You can also access our Financial Advisers at a reduced rate to help you plan your financial future.

Please note:

The safety and wellbeing of all of our employees and candidates is very important. All candidates will be interviewed over Microsoft Teams (which is smartphone, tablet and computer friendly). A virtual interview will allow you to meet the hiring panel and participate in a full interview without putting your health and safety at risk. In addition, we’re moving to a virtual onboarding process for all new starters. If you have any questions, please contact recruitment@unisuper.com.au

data.contentHTML:
We’re looking for software engineers, computer scientists, self taught developers, humans and/or aliens that are eager to join us!

The team you will be joining is fast paced, independent, ambitious and proficient across the full tech stack, but if you specialise in the back end - Python (particularly Django) but also other typical server-side language like Ruby, Go, Java, PHP, Node.js, Clojure, Scala, Rust - then we have tailored this job ad just for you! ;)

In order to join the team, you’ll be:
  • Technically competent and have solid experience in software development for the web preferably in languages like Python, Ruby, Go, Node.js.
  • Highly accountable to your work
  • Excited and passionate about technology
  • An advocate for good customer experience
  • Entrepreneurial and excited by business outcomes
  • Experienced in working in an Agile, Lean, Scrum, Kanban (pick your flavour!) team
  • A person who can Get Things Done
Although the role is ’full stack’ we know that not all teams are set up like us. So, if you’ve built up experience in the back end and don’t know much Javascript we are definitely still keen to chat. We know that ‘awesome’ engineers can learn our stack, regardless of their familiarity with Python / React / . What is important to us, is technical competency to solve problems, a desire to be across the full stack and the ability to own and deliver business outcomes.

HOW TO APPLY

To apply, please email dev.jobs@kogan.com with a subject line beginning with [BEDEV2020] . ( Do not use the application buttons etc on the site hosting the listing, they will not be reviewed! ) Tell us about yourself, your relevant experience (CV/github/etc) and why you’d like to work here.

We’re looking forward to meeting you! In the meantime, you can learn more about us on the developer blog at https://devblog.kogan.com and Kogan.com careers site:
http://careers.kogan.com [http://careers.kogan.com]
The Technology We Own
Our core product, which we built and own end - to - end is our responsive site - kogan.com. We are consistently building new features and technologies (as well as removing older ones) to ensure we are offering our customers the world’s best online experience (this is also why we build our solution, and don’t buy an off-shelf solution to join the ‘status-quo’).

Our team also builds and launches new sites, products and services throughout the year -- in 2019 - we built and launched the Kogan Super join process and the entire mobile management and billing solution for Kogan Mobile in NZ. And we’re just getting started...You in?

[JOB SEO KEYWORDS TO ENSURE THIS JOB FINDS THE RIGHT PEOPLE]
eact, Webpack, Javascript, Redux, Flux, Developer, Engineer, Web Design, Python, Django, Backbone, Redux, Angular JS, Redis, Postgresql, Celery, RabbitMQ, ElasticSearch, Puppet, Ansible, Salt, Chef, Java, Ruby, Scala, Pub/Sub, Go, Clojure, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Jenkins, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Big Data, Machine Learning, Ai, Data Science, Docker, Kubernetes, Containers, Fargate

data.contentHTML:
• Permanent opportunity
  • Northern suburbs location with free on site parking
  • Taking ownership & become a Lead across the full SDLC

Based in the Northern Suburbs, this organisation is continuing to grow in the Software and Product space. Due to the company growth they are now looking to bring on board a Software Developer who has the potential to become a Team Leader and oversee not just the full SDLC but also the Software Development team.
This position is still hands on and will report to the Development & IoT Manager and will include Mentoring/Guiding and providing the Training to further develop the Developers skills.
One of this organisations Projects is to produce a Web based system that provides a platform to deliver functionality by monitoring a wide range of field equipment and allowing authorised users to display and manage this equipment via Browser Technology.
The Web browser will need to take advantage of Google Maps and therefore will integrate with Google API.
The Web based system will be developed using the Java Platform and/or other associated high level Development Platforms as well as MS Windows.
To be considered for this permanent opportunity, my client is looking for the successful person to have previous experience working with/in:
  • Solid programming skills in Web Page Development across Java, also solid working knowledge ideally of Java Servlets, Web API's, Google API, Python, JavaScript, C++, jQuery/React, Angular and MySQL.
  • Having knowledge of IoT, Virtual Private Networks, Firewalls and Systems Security would also be highly regarded but not a necessity.
This company offer the flexibility during the day with regards to starting and finishing times, whether it be for family or missing the bulk of the traffic.
Also having the flexibility of working from home if needed.
To be considered for this fantastic opportunity, please send your resume in WORD Format, clicking on the "Apply Now" button or for a confidential phone chat, please call Katrina Thorburn on 03 8373 3404.

• Non-For Profit empowering the world
  • CBD location (when normality comes back)
  • $80K - $130K + Super

A productivity tool for Intellects
  • Non-For Profit empowering the world
  • CBD location (when normality comes back)
  • $80K - $130K + Super
Company
Have you ever met with a company and realise that the problem they are solving is bigger than them? A dream goal is a ride of a lifetime and when you are solving a niche problem that solves and exposes many ethical enigmas in the world you will become a dreamer also.
This is a Non-For Profit product that is saving lives and disabilities.

Having international successes such as partnering with 5 of the top 8 universities in America, this start-up that is growing out of its infancy with a huge trajectory. They will be helping many humans around the world. We are currently working on a Cov-19 project.

Working in the research and innovation domain of science this company optimises workflows in a unique way by utilising Machine Learning and internal data processing to train their algorithm. We are looking at ontology to enhance reusables with our values being Mission-driven, Empathy, Quality and Collaboration.

Role
Ideally being somebody who loves helping people you will be an engineer who is more focused on the front-end as you contribute to our React codebase and have an input into the direction we are going. Some of the stack is in Backbone and as we integrate more ML you will be a driving force for the front-end. Here we utilise the Ruby on Rails stack on Heroku so if you have worked with this language/platform before then this is highly advantageous.

Due to being hypothesis-driven we are big on testing so want to see this. We have the largest user base in the world, so the solution has to be robust due to working with a terabit of data.


You
  • 4+ Years of Software Engineering Experience
  • 3+ Full-stack Experience
  • Up to date JavaScript experience – (React / State Management favourable)
  • Testing experience - Jest, Jasmine, mocha, chai etc or RSpec
  • Have a proven experience building, testing, deploying and maintaining web applications
  • Have worked across the whole stack
  • Are Eager to learn
  • Are Passionate

Bonus

  • Cloud experience
  • Eye for design
  • interested in somantic technology
  • Scaling Rails applications
  • You read blogs, keep up to date and know leaders in the industry
  • Worked in a start-up

This product is going from strength to strength so as you grow technically and personally so will the company. Here there is a real sense of care and opportunity to grow into a leadership role. Here there is flexibility like it is 2020 with 3/4 day work opportunities as an option.

Send us your CV / folio / GitHub and we’ll get in touch for a chat.
If you’d like more information about this opportunity, email Alex on 0481 868 551

APPLY NOW!

Valid PR or Citizenship needed

Know someone who would be great for this job? Refer them and help a friend :)

data.contentHTML:
• Excellent day rate
  • Melbourne CBD
  • Highly visible greenfields project, Global market leader

Company Overview

Global, Leading Investments Organisation is looking for a talented Senior Developer to join their Melbourne team.

With a stellar reputation among their peers, their focus is on quality, collaboration and challenging the status quo.

Role Overview

Due to continued growth, this role contributes to one of the most significant projects this organisation has undertaken. Based in the talented Web Delivery team, you'll play a pivotal role in working on of their greeefield public facing website, working closely with a Scrum team to deliver a solution that is world-class.

This role is requires a UI Specialist with a background and understanding of Java systems. This team has a dynamic approach to work so would require you to work on back end modules.

Skills & Experience

You will likely have experience as a Developer in both Angular and Java with a solid background in developing complex web applications. You will have:
  • Extensive experience as a Full Stack Developer.
  • Angular 4-8 (UI) experience.
  • Strong knowledge of JavaScript, HTML & CSS.
  • Experience in Java based Domain Driven Designed
  • Understanding of AWS and related techs.
  • Strong BDD & TDD experience (DDD is desirable)
  • Deep understanding of software development principals and design patterns
  • Experience performing code reviews
  • Demonstrable experience in software design and delivery in an Agile environment.
  • Good problem solving, troubleshooting and debugging skills
What’s on Offer

This is a rare opportunity to join a high performing team and have the chance to make your mark on an exciting new project.

Express interest by hitting ‘apply now’ or call Jonny Jameson for more information on 02 9240 6351

data.contentHTML:
• Permanent opportunity
  • Northern suburbs location with free on site parking
  • Taking ownership & become a Lead across the full SDLC

Based in the Northern Suburbs, this organisation is continuing to grow in the Software and Product space. Due to the company growth they are now looking to bring on board a Software Developer who has the potential to become a Team Leader and oversee not just the full SDLC but also the Software Development team.
This position is still hands on and will report to the Development & IoT Manager and will include Mentoring/Guiding and providing the Training to further develop the Developers skills.
One of this organisations Projects is to produce a Web based system that provides a platform to deliver functionality by monitoring a wide range of field equipment and allowing authorised users to display and manage this equipment via Browser Technology.
The Web browser will need to take advantage of Google Maps and therefore will integrate with Google API.
The Web based system will be developed using the Java Platform and/or other associated high level Development Platforms as well as MS Windows.
To be considered for this permanent opportunity, my client is looking for the successful person to have previous experience working with/in:
  • Solid programming skills in Web Page Development across Java, also solid working knowledge ideally of Java Servlets, Web API's, Google API, Python, JavaScript, C++, jQuery/React, Angular and MySQL.
  • Having knowledge of IoT, Virtual Private Networks, Firewalls and Systems Security would also be highly regarded but not a necessity.
This company offer the flexibility during the day with regards to starting and finishing times, whether it be for family or missing the bulk of the traffic.
Also having the flexibility of working from home if needed.
To be considered for this fantastic opportunity, please send your resume in WORD Format, clicking on the "Apply Now" button or for a confidential phone chat, please call Katrina Thorburn on 03 8373 3404.

data.contentHTML:
• Be part of a high performing company with endless progression opportunities
  • Excellent location in brand new offices with the newest technology
  • Competitive salary on offer - inclusive of discounts across multiple brands

My client is currently recruiting for a Team Lead for it's Front-End developer team. This role will be responsible for conceiving, planning, developing, and deploying cutting-edge eCommerce web experiences. You will have multiple years of experience writing custom HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and solid understanding of the concept of progressive enhancement, mobile first and future friendly design.

Responsibilities
  • Extensive experience with E-Commerce websites
  • Worked with creative teams, UI & UX to ensure there are no technical barriers to suggested designs
  • Superior and efficient HTML5, CSS3 skills; W3C standards and SEO principles
  • Solid understanding of Responsive Design
  • A good understanding in the use of JavaScript Libraries and Frameworks, such as React and Angular
  • Proficiency in writing maintainable JavaScript code
  • Understanding of mobile and web-based design constraints, editors, browser platforms, and their differences - along with the experience to develop and code accordingly
  • A flexible and collaborative approach in fast-paced production environments
  • The ability to provide thoughts and insights throughout the development process, and the ability to constructively contribute technical feedback to the team on various projects
  • The ability to understand business functions to analyse and propose technical strategies for the business
  • The ability to take personal responsibility for personal growth, acquires strategies for gaining new knowledge, behaviours and skills
  • The ability to breakdown raw information and undefined problems into specific, workable components that in-turn clearly identifies the issues at hand
Skills & Experience
  • Proficiency across React and AWS (Amazon Web Services)
  • Strong working knowledge of .NET
  • Retail experience would be highly regarded
  • Leadership experience is essential - at least 4 direct reports
  • Strong team player to join the collaborative team

    To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below or email your resume to:
    rachelmurphy@jivaro.com.au

data.contentHTML:
• CBD location.
  • Fantastic employee benefits
  • A diverse position within a collaborative team

This well known and extremely reputable organisation are growing, currently in the early stages of a Technology Uplift and Transformation and due to this they are looking to bring on board a SharePoint Developer to add to their team.
This a permanent position based in the Melbourne CBD and just a few minutes walk to public transport.

This organisation really look after you building caring and collaborative relationships also having fantastic employee benefits.
This is a diverse position as they are currently going through a major uplift.
The primary purpose of this position is to deliver effective SharePoint solutions, processes and strategies to support the operational and strategic needs of the business.

Other responsibilities included in this position are:
  • Serving as a SME maintaining and providing support and providing further strategy ideas for SharePoint Applications within the organisation.
  • Ensuring that the number of defects at implementation stage are extremely minimal.
  • Liaising with the business on user application bugs/issues and resolve within the agreed timelines.
  • Ensuring that any changes in accordance with legislative and statutory requirement deadlines are met.
  • Delivering ICT Systems configuration specifically for Data Changes and sanctions to enable system processing to meet business requirements.
To be considered for this fantastic permanent opportunity, the Hiring Manager is looking for the successful person to ideally have:
  • Extensive Development experience with SharePoint 2013 and above.
  • Ideally an in depth understanding of: O365, C#, .Net, Master Page CSS/JavaScript/Angular JS, REST API's, SQL-SSRS, Bootstrap.
  • A proven extensive working background within an overall MS environment.
  • Having exposure to Sitecore would be an advantage but definitely not a necessity,
  • A working knowledge with ITIL and SDLC methodology.
To be considered for this fantastic opportunity, please send your resume in WORD Format, clicking on the "Apply Now" button below or for a confidential phone chat, please call Katrina Thorburn on 03 8373 3404.

data.contentHTML:
• Great Consultancy Environment
  • Long Term Engagement
  • Melbourne CBD

Global Consulting Services (GCS) has been an industry leader in the specialist areas of IT and Business consulting since 1986.The organisation is currently positioning itself for some exciting growth opportunities. GCS is a Melbourne-based leading and trusted global solutions company that differentiates our clients across all sectors in the digitally disrupted world, with global delivery capability spanning 11 Countries and 14 Cities.

Due to an upcoming project and expected ramp up we are looking for multiple Full Stack Developers to join our consulting practice.

To be considered for this exciting gig, you should have:

  • Strong experience as a Java Full Stack Developer.
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver applications with Angular JS/Node JS/JavaScript within an agile approach.
  • Proven ability to translate business concepts into a robust and commercially viable technical solution.
  • Solid experience in participating in design meetings and consulting with clients to refine, test and debug programs to meet business needs.
  • Excellent presentation and stakeholder engagement skills (both written and verbal)
  • Good understanding of relational database design and modelling.

Desirable skills:
  • Experience with testing tools/processes (automated tools would also be highlighted)
  • CI/CD experience (containerized deployment – Docker)
  • Experience with REACT and or Ruby on Rails
  • Integration Experience with Mulesoft and or any other ESB.

If you are currently eligible to work in Australia, possess the above skills and experience we would like to hear from you. For further information about this opportunity please view the vacancy posting in the Job Centre section of our website or feel free to call us on 03) 9347 3055, quoting reference number 973906

data.contentHTML:
We’re looking for software engineers, computer scientists, self taught developers, humans and/or aliens that are eager to join us!

The team you will be joining is fast paced, independent, ambitious and proficient across the full tech stack.

In order to join the team, you’ll be:
  • Technically competent and have solid experience in software development for the web preferably in languages like Python, Ruby, Go, Clojure, Java/.NET and/or Javascript, React, Redux, Webpack, HTML & CSS
  • Highly accountable for your work and outcomes
  • Excited and passionate about technology
  • An advocate for good customer experience
  • Entrepreneurial and excited by business outcomes
  • Experienced in working in an Agile, Lean, Scrum, Kanban (pick your flavour!) team
  • Experience with infrastructure/ops on AWS, Google Cloud, Azure a bonus - as we manage our own infrastructure too!
  • A person who can Get Things Done
Although the role is ’full stack’ we know that not all teams are set up like us. So, if you’ve built up experience in the back end and don’t know much Javascript or vice versa we are definitely still keen to chat. We know that ‘awesome’ engineers can learn our stack, regardless of their familiarity with Python / React / . What is important to us, is technical competency to solve problems, a desire to be across the full stack and the ability to own and deliver business outcomes.

HOW TO APPLY

To apply, please email dev.jobs@kogan.com [dev.jobs@kogan.com] with a subject line beginning with [FSDEV2020] . ( Do not use the application buttons etc on the site hosting the listing, they will not be reviewed! ) Tell us about yourself, your relevant experience (CV/github/etc) and why you’d like to work here.

We’re looking forward to meeting you! In the meantime, you can learn more about us on the developer blog at https://devblog.kogan.com and Kogan.com careers site:
http://careers.kogan.com [http://careers.kogan.com]

The Technology We Own
Our core product, which we built and own end - to - end is our responsive site - kogan.com. We are consistently building new features and technologies (as well as removing older ones) to ensure we are offering our customers the world’s best online experience (this is also why we build our solution, and don’t buy an off-shelf solution to join the ‘status-quo’).

Our team also builds and launches new sites, products and services throughout the year -- in 2019 - we built and launched the Kogan Super join process and the entire mobile management and billing solution for Kogan Mobile in NZ. And we’re just getting started...You in?

[JOB SEO KEYWORDS TO ENSURE THIS JOB FINDS THE RIGHT PEOPLE]
React, Webpack, Javascript, Redux, Flux, Developer, Engineer, Web Design, Python, Django, Backbone, Redux, Angular JS, Redis, Postgresql, Celery, RabbitMQ, ElasticSearch, Puppet, Ansible, Salt, Chef, Java, Ruby, Scala, Pub/Sub, Go, Clojure, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Jenkins, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Big Data, Machine Learning, Ai, Data Science, Docker, Kubernetes, Containers, Fargate

data.contentHTML:
Location:
Melbourne

Job Type:
Contract

Specialisation:
Banking & Financial Services

Reference:
(SS)49425

FinXL IT Professional Services is an innovative Australian owned company providing our clients with technology enabled business solutions and consulting services. We have 20 years of year on year success. Our teams specialise in the following areas of technology recruitment (contract and permanent): DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS Android| Front End Development| Back End Development | UX | UI | Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery.

We are looking for Full Stack Java Developer as part of a highly skilled team of consultants working in our Tier 1 Client in Melbourne CBD.
You will be assigned in to one of our clients many project portfolios encompassing digital initiatives and revolutionary payment systems. You will likely be exposed to many up to date technologies which you can built on to your current development skills sets and experience.

This role will be within our enterprise client’s IT Digital Services projects developing digital customer UI, business systems and applications.

Experience required:
We are looking for an experienced full stack Software Engineer with a proven track record of running critical shared application platforms in a production cloud environment.

Job Description:
Work with business and technology stakeholders to understand and analyse requirements and metrics to establish realizable specifications.

Design, build, test and deploy software solutions that meet our goals (including UI, APIs, business logic & data components).

Write well-designed, testable clean code and automated tests.

Continuously improve and enhance and existing software where necessary.

Working with Security, Architecture and Infrastructure teams to simplify the adoption of cloud & build the enforcement of guard rails.

Analyse production incidents when they occur and help work on fixes to resolve problems.

Promoting cloud-native architectures, designs and development techniques for new and existing systems.

Document and communicate your work throughout the whole SDLC .

Required skills:
Highly proficient in software development in Java, Node, Python, Typescript.

UI development experience, ideally React.

Serverless, Microservice & Container based application development.

Design and Architecture experience (Evolutionary, Resilient) .

Experience with a broad range of AWS Services.

Continuous Delivery Engineering - pipeline tooling (Linux, Github, Jenkins, Artifactory, SonarQube, Jira, Confluence) .

Tertiary qualification in Software Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience.

4+ years of software development experience.

3+ years working in with public cloud and certification (AWS, Azure or GCP).

To apply for this fantastic opportunity, please create a cover letter outlining your reason(s) for consideration, along with an up to date catered C.V to sahithis@finxl.com.au or push ‘Apply Now’.
Shortlisted consultants are contacted shortly.

data.jobTitle: Full Stack Software Engineer - Cyber Security Products - Remote Working
data.contentHTML:
• Remote working from Melbourne
  • Fast career growth opportunity
  • Supportive team
  • Paying up to $100k base + equity opportunity
  • Choose your tech stack

Are you looking to make a difference?

A rare opportunity has arisen to join a hugely rewarding and promising Australian company.

As an early hire you will be building products true to their mission (to protect those who cannot protect themselves) which has thus attracted some highly rewarding, confidential & unique intelligence operations - creating software that protects the security & welfare of Australian citizens.

The problems their products are solving involve the use of a range of technologies including machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision, data stream processing and data analytics + whatever you see fit!

Their current Tech Stack, which you are invited to add to is:-
  • Node.js
  • React.js
  • MongoDB
  • Angular.js
  • Python
  • Java
  • AWS
  • Azure

What your exciting days will look like:-
  • Building products nobody else is doing in Australia
  • Creating new ideas, software, features and enhancements
  • Collaborating with the expert team across multiple products and projects
  • Coding across multiple languages
  • Very fast pace development environment
  • Peer to peer code reviews
  • Continued training and personal growth
  • One click deployments
  • Establishing CI/CD, TDD and Unit testing processes

Your other awesome skills & experience:-
  • Extensive commercial experience as a Full Stack Software Engineer and/or similar position
  • Need to have worked on Cyber Security based products
  • Develop and design software products
  • Strong in either Java,.Net or Python
  • Strong business acumen (this is a dream role for a future Co-Founder, Architect & CTO)
  • Knowledge of UI/UX
  • End-to-end product development experience
  • Experience with Angular.js or Node.js or React.js,
  • Microservices
  • MongoDB
  • Worked in Startup type of environments
  • CI/CD, TDD and Unit testing
  • Agile and/or pair programming environments
Your benefits & perks:-
  • Fast tracked career growth
  • Choose your own development language
  • Opportunity to work remotely
  • Equity options
Working closely with the Founder, Product Manager & SW team, this role will expose you to a myriad of opportunities & should develop into a CTO role here.

****Their Head office is based in Canberra. However, this is an opportunity where you can work remotely.

Real Time Australia is a specialist IT Recruitment Company. If you are interested in this role, or any IT related opportunities, please send your cover letter & resume to matthew.kiker@realtimeaustralia.com or contact me directly on (03) 9999 5432.

data.contentHTML:
We are on the look out for an experienced and talented Software Engineer with exposure to DevOps practices, or a Software DevOps engineer, with previous experience using AS4 services.

This is a large migration project, based in Melbourne. We are looking for someone who thinks outside the box and has a flexible approach with the way they work.

You will get the chance to work in a face paced environment with top tier clients.

Day to Day responsibilities:
  • Deploying and managing GitLab - configuration, access control, issue management;
  • Provide 2nd and 3rd level support to different teams and developers
  • Developing CI/CD solutions for application and system configuration management and deployment
  • Maintaining and managing the configuration of infrastructure to make sure company applications run smoothly
  • Collaborating with developers to implement solutions to improve application performance
  • Evaluating and Improving Server and Application security
  • Database management and maintenance
  • Patching and Maintaining servers, both physical and virtual
The Ideal Candidate Will:
  • Be highly experienced with Linux support - preferably Redhat
  • Have previous experience and/or a strong understanding of AS4 services and XML
  • Be able to write clean code and script in HTML, JavaScript and/or Bash
  • Have previous experience with SQL - MySQL management and queries
  • Have strong experience with configuration management using GitLab or Git; as well as building CICD pipelines
  • Have previous experience with Rest APIs
  • Have excellent communication skills, both written and spoken

Company Benefits:
  • Long term company growth
  • StartUp culture
  • Competitive salary of $120k - $130k + super
If this sounds like you, please send your CV to louise.oconnor@s2p.com.au

data.contentHTML:
• Great Consultancy Environment
  • Long Term Engagement
  • Melbourne CBD

Global Consulting Services (GCS) has been an industry leader in the specialist areas of IT and Business consulting since 1986.The organisation is currently positioning itself for some exciting growth opportunities. GCS is a Melbourne-based leading and trusted global solutions company that differentiates our clients across all sectors in the digitally disrupted world, with global delivery capability spanning 11 Countries and 14 Cities.

Due to an upcoming project and expected ramp up we are looking for multiple Full Stack Developers to join our consulting practice.

To be considered for this exciting gig, you should have:

  • Strong experience as a Java Full Stack Developer.
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver applications with Angular JS/Node JS/JavaScript within an agile approach.
  • Proven ability to translate business concepts into a robust and commercially viable technical solution.
  • Solid experience in participating in design meetings and consulting with clients to refine, test and debug programs to meet business needs.
  • Excellent presentation and stakeholder engagement skills (both written and verbal)
  • Good understanding of relational database design and modelling.

Desirable skills:
  • Experience with testing tools/processes (automated tools would also be highlighted)
  • CI/CD experience (containerized deployment – Docker)
  • Experience with REACT and or Ruby on Rails
  • Integration Experience with Mulesoft and or any other ESB.

If you are currently eligible to work in Australia, possess the above skills and experience we would like to hear from you. For further information about this opportunity please view the vacancy posting in the Job Centre section of our website or feel free to call us on 03) 9347 3055, quoting reference number 973906

Test Lead

This is an exciting opportunity with an organisation that is quickly expanding their IT department and modernising their landscape, having just moved to the cloud and aiming to adopt an agile way of running projects.

The Test Analyst will play an important role in the planning, design, management, execution and reporting of tests and that the risks associated with deployment are adequately understood and documented.

Location: Melbourne CBD
Start date: December/January
Salary: 100-115k + super

Experience required:
  • ISTQB certified;
  • HP ALM;
  • End to end testing;
  • Strong in at least one of the following programming languages:
    • Java;
    • .Net;
    • Angular;
  • Performed testing on Cloud/web based applications;
  • Tested in an Agile/Scrum environment (preferred);
  • Good understanding/experience with automation testing;
  • Cloud (AWS/Azure DevOps) experience (preferred).

Please note: Only those with a relevant background will be contacted

• Brilliant job opportunity
  • Long 12 month contract
  • Opportunity to move into other skills

Milestone IT is currently working with this brilliant business who are a multinational blue chip corporate. Right now, they have a very exciting opportunity for an individual to join their team.

Working alongside a number of creative teams you will focus on digital assets and will help them come to life. Specifically banner adverts and responsive web banners. You will work as an all-rounder including digital elements, animated html5 web design, email creatives.

This role is running initially for 12 months with the likelihood of going permanent and certainly the opportunity to move further into a web development team.

To be suitable you will bring :

  • Strong HTML5/CSS3 skills.
  • Best web development practice.
  • Strong SVG manipulation knowledge.
  • Javascript
  • Ability to craft your design without various frameworks.
  • Strong attention to detail.

This business will also present you with a one in a lifetime chance to get perhaps the best business in Australia on your CV.

If you have the skills, please send your CV to apply@mstone.com.au or phone 0396706682 for more information.

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact David Sparrius on (03) 9670 6682.

data.contentHTML:
Short Description:

If your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for you.

Location:

  • 1st preference Canberra.
  • 2nd preference : Melbourne

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Configuration and Customization of Dynamics 365 CRM.
  • Creating plug-ins, custom workflow activities.
  • Creating Dashboards, Charts and Reports.
  • Setting up DES (Data Extract Service).

Skills /Competencies:

Essential :

  • Should have worked on Power Automate.
  • Hands-on experience working on Dynamics CRM or PowerApps Portals
  • Should have worked on Azure services like Azure Function Apps, Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Key Vault.
  • Experience in working in Agile projects and using tools such as JIRA and Confluence
  • Experience in at-lease one full-cycle implementations for Dynamics 365 CRM
  • Tertiary Qualification in IT / Computer Science / related discipline.

Preferred:

  • 3+ years of relevant experience on MS Dynamics 365 CRM with an overall experience of 4+ years on CRM.
  • Good knowledge of latest Javascript libraries such as ReactJS and AngularJS.
  • Microsoft Certified Professional on Dynamics 365.
  • Should have experience working on integrations.
  • Data Migration experience using tools like Scribe and SSIS with Kingswaysoft is a plus.
  • Large Systems Integrator (SI) experience is an added advantage.
  • Should be familiar with modern cloud patterns and practices.
  • Azure experience preferred.

Additional Skills:

  • Excellent customer interfacing skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills.

Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender or other attribute covered by equal opportunity legislation.

At Infosys, we recognize that everyone has individual requirements. If you are a person with disability, illness or injury and require adjustments to the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Recruitment team for adjustment only on Infosys_ta (at) infosys (dot) com or include your preferred method of communication in email and someone will be in touch.

Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. In the absence of a signed agreement any submission will be deemed as non-binding and Infosys explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire the submitted profile. All recruitment activity must be coordinated through the Talent Acquisition department.

EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin

About Infosys:

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Experience:

  • Total IT: 4 years (Required)
  • MS Dynamics 365 CRM: 3 years (Preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor Degree (Preferred)

• Attractive daily Rates
  • Melbourne
  • Work on something more meaningful

About the company
We’re working with a really exciting global company, which works largely within the health sector. With their main value being to utilise technology to improve people's lives around the globe.

About the role
We are seeking a team player who is keen to develop products within a fast-growing business. You will be supporting a tight-knit team of top tier developers, reporting directly to the Lead Engineer.
  • Expand your knowledge, using the latest cutting-edge technology
  • Help build exciting and meaningful applications
  • Work closely with others in a highly Agile environment
Skills & experience
This job is for someone who is curious, a team-player, and somebody wanting to work on a more meaningful project. Ideally, you’ll have had prior experience working within a small team or Agile environment, and you will be comfortable with high levels of accountability. Does this sound like you? Yes. Wanting to work for a more meaningful company? Absolutely!
Great! Let’s move onto the more nitty-gritty stuff.

You will preferably have 4+ years’ experience working with:
  • Ionic (must have!)
  • Cordova
  • Angular
  • JavaScript

You will have:
  • Excellent communication and people skills
  • A strong technical background
  • Structured problem solver
  • Fast Paced and high performance
  • Highly motivated and goal driven
  • A growth mindset with the ability to deliver results

Culture
A diverse culture of highly intelligent, values-driven people who like to have fun, are passionate about their product, and generally care about making a positive impact on the next generation.

Benefits
  • Flexible working environment
  • Attractive daily rates
  • Collaborative and sociable culture

How to apply
Click APPLY or Brianna on 03 9245 0609 for a confidential discussion.

Ionic (must have!)
Cordova
Angular
JavaScript

You will have:
Excellent communication and people skills
A strong technical background
Structured problem solver
Fast Paced and high performance
Highly motivated and goal driven
A growth mindset with the ability to deliver results

Culture

A diverse culture of highly intelligent, values-driven people who like to have fun, are passionate about their product, and generally care about making a positive impact on the next generation.

Benefits
Flexible working environment
Attractive daily rates
Collaborative and sociable culture

How to apply

Click APPLY or Brianna on 03 9245 0609 for a confidential discussion.

Their platform is for financial advisors but blends deep industry knowledge with cloud software expertise. My client covers financial services by putting the client at the heart of everything!

As a Salesforce Engineer you will be responsible for not only gathering requirements and eliciting ideas, but also using their technical experience to implement solutions. You will use your understanding of retail issues along with you understanding of solutions to creatively solve complex issues.

You will play an important role in the project management team, acting as a bridge to the developers as well as being hands on. This means you will be able to communicate effectively to both, using technical language where necessary.

Skills & Requirements
  • Solid understanding of Salesforce data models, process automation tools
  • Perform the technical configuration of the Salesforce platforms to support the successful onboarding of new clients.
  • Able to work on point-and-click configuration of custom pages & Custom Fields
  • Fantastic relationship builder
  • Experience in CSS and Javascript within the Skuid framework.
  • Documenting Business Requirements
  • Experience of delivering large projects on the Force.com platform
  • Understand and be able to operate using both agile-scrum and Waterfall delivery approaches
You MUST be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident

Company Description

null


Job Description

About Hyper Anna

We’re a fast growth software start-up in the AI and data analytics space, and we’re on a mission to democratise data. Founded in 2016, we’ve built an AI powered data analytics platform that is transforming how businesses use data. Our software enables users to interact with their data in natural language, and proactively scans and presents the user with tailored insights within seconds. This means no need to wait on dashboards to be created or reports to be written, you are empowered to be curious about your business every day.

Behind our software is a growing team that is disrupting the analytics industry. People who love solving real world problems with smart ideas and smart technology. We're product builders, creative thinkers and we always go that extra step to delight our customers. Does that sound like you? Read on!

About the opportunity

We’re looking for a Senior Javascript Developer to entrust with the interesting technical challenges involved in building and scaling SaaS software. You’ll be working in a cross functional team (engineers, designers and data scientists) and on a product that is disrupting the big data and analytics market. You’ll be a huge advocate for software best practices, mentor the team, and help us to get the most out of our stack as we design and deliver new features and functionality for our software.

A day in your life will include:

  • Being responsible for the development of high performance features
  • Working in a cross functional team to solve technical challenges
  • Being involved in software and service architecture discussions
  • Designing and adopting strong engineering practices

About you:

You’re passionate, up to date on new technologies, and have strong software development fundamentals. You know when to obsess over details and when it’s time to ship. You love working in teams and helping others to grow with you. You’re someone who is laid-back, adaptable and wants to have an impact on the product you work on.

2020 will be a huge year for us and you have the opportunity to join us at the beginning of our hyper growth phase! This means you’ll have access to real career opportunities as we grow, receive a competitive salary and pre-IPO equity.

We're building software for the data revolution, come and join us.


Qualifications

null

Additional Information

null

data.contentHTML:
About 4mation


4mation is a full service custom web and software agency offering end to end project delivery by industry experts. We are proud to say we’re among Australia’s best places to work- ranking reliably in the top 10 in Australia. Our team enjoy an awesome environment and unique benefits.

What does the average day look like for you?
You'd be embedded with one of our best clients- We’re talking about one of the most reputable and well-known companies in Australia, with one of the swankiest offices around.

You’ll be introduced as a senior resource in a team that develops their core product, which you probably use every single day. Ideally, you’ll come from a commercial environment and have experience working in larger software development teams. You’ll be our resident react expert, and we’ll rely on you for the coaching, mentoring and development of the team you’re embedded in.

Every day you’ll go to work with the best engineers in Australia, you’ll learn a lot, fast. You’ll get all the training and development you need to be successful, and if your successful in the role, career progression is practically guaranteed.

As a 4mation React Developer, you will:


  • Write amazing user interfaces using JavaScript and React JS technologies
  • Liase with our head of contracts and consultancy to deliver the best possible value to our Clients.
  • Build clean re-usable components with a focus on scalability
  • Have a positive attitude and willingness to learn


Skills and experience


  • Significant front-end development experience using React JS & JavaScript
  • Solid experience in agile software development practices
  • Understanding of full-stack web applications
  • Ability to create and work with APIs
  • Experience in integrating with third-party systems
  • Knowledge of and experience with client-side web development frameworks - ideally the React ecosystem (including Redux and React-Router)
  • Experience managing work through task management systems, ideally Jira.
  • Some experience with Microservice architecture is desirable
  • Experience with concepts such as CI/CD and DevOps
  • Experience with source control, ideally Git
  • Experience with Design System development and management


Benefits and culture


You’ll be working for a company that puts its staff first- embedded in one of the big 3 software development companies in Sydney. You’re essentially doubling down on awesome benefits this way. As for our benefits- check them out over here- https://careers.4mation.com.au/why-4mation/#our-office-perks

As for the rest of them- well, Let’s save the details for the interview but I can promise you won’t be disappointed with them all.

Location:
Sydney

Job Type:
Contract

Specialisation:
Telecommunications

Reference:
(JG)49373_1

  • Work from Home and Pennant Hills location
  • Great work environment
  • Great Team
The Role:
This is a great role for a Network Implementation Engineer to work for a large telecommunications organisation. The role will include shift work and will be both work from home and based in Pennant Hills.

Who you are:
You will have the following skills/experience:
  • 3 year minimum in teams within telecommunications or IT environments with a focus on capacity and performance management
  • 2 years minimum within telecommunications preferably HFC operations
  • A strong background in DONS, CMTS upgrades, network implementation and data analytics for HFC including RF including spectrum management and Optical Node Splitting
  • Bachelor of Engineering in Telecommunications, Electrical or Tertiary qualifications in telecommunications related disciplines or equivalent
  • Familiarity with current telecommunications technology developments
  • A good understanding of DOCSIS technologies is required.
What’s on offer

This is a 6 months + Contract in highly regarded organisation

What’s next

If you would like to be considered, please send applications to jackieg@finxl.com.au or contact Jackie Gibbons on 02 8243 6822 to discuss further.

Who we are:
FinXL IT Professional Services is an established, innovative Australian company, providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries. These include; Government, Telecommunications, Commercial and Finance. We currently have more than 1200 consultants assisting our clients across Australia and are continuing to grow at a rapid pace. Through the delivery of services and implementation of new systems, processes and technology, we assist our clients to gain competitive advantage and reach new heights.

Reference Number: S100-20-643
Closing Date: 30-04-2020
Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
Vacancy Details:
  • Salary from $72,345.29 to $86,334.48 p.a. + super
  • Full time position, 35 hours per week
  • Flexible work/life balance, 9 day fortnight

We are looking for a friendly, highly motivated and skilled Digital Communications Officer to join our team and help manage our online identity. Web development, user support skills and content management experience are essential.

Your key objective will be providing technical and project management support, internal training and advice to enhance user experience and deepen engagement, while helping to deliver a professional and customer focused online presence.

If you like people, love technology and enjoy developing creative solutions – get in touch. Come and join a small team at one of the best work locations in Sydney!

Essential Criteria:

  • Project management experience and proven ability to work on multiple tasks concurrently
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and customer service ethic
  • Advanced experience in developing, testing and maintaining web content in Squiz Matrix
  • Demonstrated experience in web development with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
  • Experience in providing training and support for staff in the use of a content management system and content creation
  • Experience in researching, analysing and reporting
  • Understanding of UX, interface design, information architecture and writing for the web
  • Understanding of web accessibility requirements and monitoring compliance

Desirable Criteria:

  • Experience with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator or similar software
  • Experience with Campaign Monitor
  • Demonstrated ability to work with APIs
  • Knowledge of current and emerging web-based technologies
  • Knowledge of local government services

How to Apply:

  • Apply on line by clicking the link below.
  • You will be asked to demonstrate how you meet each of the selection criteria.
  • If you have a separate statement addressing the selection criteria, please upload it as a cover letter and simply refer to it in the online questionnaire.
  • You will be able to upload 2 documents only.
  • For information on applying for Council jobs, please refer to http://www.woollahra.nsw.gov.au/council/employment/recruitment_and_selection_process
  • For further information about the role, please contact Raj Gopalakrishnan, Website Project Manager on 02 9391 7007 during business hours.
  • Our preference is for applications to be submitted online, however, we will accept hard copy applications addressed to Human Resources, Woollahra Council, PO Box 61, Double Bay, NSW, 1360.

CLOSING DATE: Midnight, Thursday 30 April 2020

Woollahra Council is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.

We value:

  • Respect for people
  • Integrity and excellent performance
  • Professional, quality service
  • Open, accountable communication

icare is currently seeking an experienced Senior Sitecore Developer with a commercial mindset and a passion for social impact to join the icare team!

  • Gather, refine and estimate specifications and requirements based on business and/or technical needs
  • Permanent opportunity
  • Salary from $128,089 + super

We’re looking for someone who has experience with technical responsibilities across all products and includes product maintenance and improvement. This role will use programming expertise and have a deep understanding of modern web architectures and distributed systems.

You’ll be working with a diverse mix of creative, curious and smart people who really care about making a difference for people and the NSW community. You will have a mind for getting things done and a heart for people and you will set the bar high through the quality of the work you do and the people-oriented decisions you make.

You’ll bring your experience working with Sitecore 9.x, C#, .Net, nuget, and Demonstrated working experience with UI frameworks (jQuery, React). Understanding of cross browser and device testing and debugging techniques, also Anticipate and assess changes which impact the business and exercise judgement in the absence of precedent and make decisions with significant impact.


It’s an exciting environment where no two days are the same. But on a typical day you might find yourself: Build out patterns and abstractions that emphasize the efficiency of sites and software.

  • Design and develop both internal and external facing services for enterprise application Integration of applications hosted on site and in the cloud.
  • Manage the entire software development lifecycle including analysis, design, coding, testing, build, deployment, implementation, release and support for a product.
  • Collaborate with infrastructure team, and other software developers to assist in resolving problems with software products or company software system.
  • Integrate data from various back-end services and databases and participate in code reviews.
  • Collaborate with other developers and business analysts in conceptualising and developing new software applications and enhancements and participate in project estimation and discovery sessions.
  • Create technical documents and artefacts for developed software products.

We’re a new kind of organisation, one that’s as supportive and socially conscious as it is agile and explorative. Our DNA of commercial mind and social heart captures who we are at our core.

If you think you’re the right person for this role, send us your resume (up to 5 pages). Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experience set you apart.

We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we want people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We recognise the importance of balance and flexibility and understand that it’s not a one size fits all approach, so we’d be happy to talk about and consider your specific needs.

Please note that you must be an Australian citizen or a permanent resident of Australia or a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand passport to apply for this role.

  • icare is the brand of Insurance & Care NSW
  • For more information about icare visit our website
  • icare operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions will be accepted

data.contentHTML:
AccessHQ, a Dialog Group company, is looking for Automation Consultants in Sydney.
DevOps is transforming the way in which organisations develop and deploy applications and services. Automation underpins and enables DevOps to manage and provision infrastructure and test, deploy and monitor applications throughout Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, but it's not just about technology, it's about mindset and culture and having the right people to collaborate and break down traditional silos.
AccessHQ and our clients are evolving the way we work. By combining our focus on customer experience and the DevOps mantra of 'Automate Everything' we are redefining 'Continuous Quality' and we need smart, passionate, enthusiastic people to work with us.
If that resonates, you could be just who we are looking for…

Skills and Experience Required

You will have a proven track record in software development, software quality or automation roles and a passion for working in collaborative Agile teams and solving quality issues at all stages of the SDLC.
Some of the skills which will make you stand out from the rest:
  • Demonstrable experience in Developer, SDET and Automation Engineer type roles
  • Hands o n experience writing OOP code in Java, C#, Python, JavaScript etc.
  • Experience working with GUI, Web, Web Services and Mobile applications
  • Best practice Test Automation with tools such as
    • Junit, TestNG, MSTest, NUnit, XUnit, Jest, Mocha etc.
    • Selenium WebDriver, Appium, Protractor, Puppeteer
    • Cucumber, SpecFlow, JBehave, Robot Framework
    • SoapUI, Postman, REST-Assured, Karate
  • Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery with one or more of the following:
    • Jenkins
    • Bamboo
    • CircleCI
    • Azure Pipelines
  • Experience with IAC, Containers and Configuration Management tools such as:
    • Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS
    • Chef, Puppet, Terraform, Cloud Formation, Azure ARM
  • Previous experience working in a consulting environment and an understanding of the commercial aspects of consulting
  • Great stakeholder management skills
  • Ability to build relationships with people from all areas of the organisation
  • A genuine interest in building capability in junior consultants

Working with AccessHQ:

  • Delivering assurance and testing solutions so clients think of AccessHQ as a trusted partner
  • Working closely with AccessHQ's account teams to build business and improve relationships
  • Improving business goals, services and processes; differentiating AccessHQ
  • Supporting the Human Quality vision with creative thinking

Who are we?

AccessHQ is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Dialog Group of companies. Dialog is Australia's largest privately-owned IT Services group, operating across the Asia-Pacific region. Employing more than 1,200 dedicated consultants, Dialog's focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients.
AccessHQ has over 20 years' experience in the assurance and testing space and is passionate about making technology live up to its promise. We believe that technology is an enabler for people to work, connect and learn. It's all about people, and too often we are forgotten in the excitement of technology development. AccessHQ is the voice of the people who use technology; whether we are customers, students, employees or citizens we're all human and all technology should have Human Quality.

Ready to apply?

Applicants must be Australian or NZ citizens or have a valid work permit.
To apply please attach your CV and cover letter to this application. If you have a public Git repository with examples of your work, please provide details in your CV or cover letter.

For more information on AccessHQ please visit www.accesshq.com
All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. Dialog Group is an equal opportunity employer.
data.contentText:
AccessHQ, a Dialog Group company, is looking for Automation Consultants in Sydney.

DevOps is transforming the way in which organisations develop and deploy applications and services. Automation underpins and enables DevOps to manage and provision infrastructure and test, deploy and monitor applications throughout Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, but it's not just about technology, it's about mindset and culture and having the right people to collaborate and break down traditional silos.
AccessHQ and our clients are evolving the way we work. By combining our focus on customer experience and the DevOps mantra of 'Automate Everything' we are redefining 'Continuous Quality' and we need smart, passionate, enthusiastic people to work with us.

If that resonates, you could be just who we are looking for…

Skills and Experience Required
You will have a proven track record in software development, software quality or automation roles and a passion for working in collaborative Agile teams and solving quality issues at all stages of the SDLC.
Some of the skills which will make you stand out from the rest:
Demonstrable experience in Developer, SDET and Automation Engineer type roles
Hands o n experience writing OOP code in Java, C#, Python, JavaScript etc.
Experience working with GUI, Web, Web Services and Mobile applications
Best practice Test Automation with tools such as
Junit, TestNG, MSTest, NUnit, XUnit, Jest, Mocha etc.
Selenium WebDriver, Appium, Protractor, Puppeteer
Cucumber, SpecFlow, JBehave, Robot Framework
SoapUI, Postman, REST-Assured, Karate
Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery with one or more of the following:
Jenkins
Bamboo
CircleCI
Azure Pipelines
Experience with IAC, Containers and Configuration Management tools such as:
Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS
Chef, Puppet, Terraform, Cloud Formation, Azure ARM
Previous experience working in a consulting environment and an understanding of the commercial aspects of consulting
Great stakeholder management skills
Ability to build relationships with people from all areas of the organisation
A genuine interest in building capability in junior consultants
Working with AccessHQ:
Delivering assurance and testing solutions so clients think of AccessHQ as a trusted partner
Working closely with AccessHQ's account teams to build business and improve relationships
Improving business goals, services and processes; differentiating AccessHQ
Supporting the Human Quality vision with creative thinking

Who are we?
AccessHQ is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Dialog Group of companies. Dialog is Australia's largest privately-owned IT Services group, operating across the Asia-Pacific region. Employing more than 1,200 dedicated consultants, Dialog's focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients.
AccessHQ has over 20 years' experience in the assurance and testing space and is passionate about making technology live up to its promise. We believe that technology is an enabler for people to work, connect and learn. It's all about people, and too often we are forgotten in the excitement of technology development. AccessHQ is the voice of the people who use technology; whether we are customers, students, employees or citizens we're all human and all technology should have Human Quality.
Ready to apply?
Applicants must be Australian or NZ citizens or have a valid work permit.
To apply please attach your CV and cover letter to this application. If you have a public Git repository with examples of your work, please provide details in your CV or cover letter.

For more information on AccessHQ please visit www.accesshq.com
All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. Dialog Group is an equal opportunity employer.

data.contentHTML:
Business Unit:

Cubic Transportation Systems

Company Details:

Cubic offers an opportunity to provide innovative technology for government and commercial customers around the globe, helping to solve their future problems today. We’re the leading integrator of payment and information technology and services for intelligent travel solutions worldwide, and the leading provider of realistic combat training systems, secure communications and networking and highly specialized support services for military and security forces of the U.S. and allied nations. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and thrive in an innovative environment, we want to talk to you about your next role at Cubic! We are seeking employees inspired by technology, and motivated by the rewards of hard work, commitment, teamwork, quality, integrity, and respect. We invite you to explore opportunities with Cubic.

Job Details:

The Role

As part of the Engineering Team, the Senior .Net Developer will assist in the development of interfaces and software that support multi-modal management capabilities for Transport Management organisations worldwide.

This role will help to define and clarify technical requirements and by providing feedback on the design and implementation when required.

About You

You will have a Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent) in Software Engineering or Computer Science with a minimum 5 years .NET and C# experience in a structured back-end development environment.

To be considered for this role you will posses the following Skills/Experience/Knowledge:

  • Angular experience - essential
  • Strong understanding of enterprise and design patterns and principles
  • Experience developing applications using a micro-services architecture

Most importantly, you will be a positive team player with the ability to work autonomously and within a cross-functional team environment.

Worker Type:

Employee
