data.contentHTML:
Based at oe of ourAustralin Hubs in either Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane or Perth and reporting to the Global IT Technical Manager, this roleprovides Regional Technical and Operational Support team leadership and to assist with the design and implementation of IT systems to drive business results. Secondary responsibilities involve bringing efficiencies in IT operations to help streamline system and application delivery in line with business objectives. These systems should provide the customers at large with an excellent user experience with systems scaled to achieve the strategic objectives of the business. This role has active input into IT service strategy, design, transition and operations and will support the Global IT Technical Manger in the delivery of IT Operations including (Infrastructure, Network, End User Computing, Site setup projects and Operational Integrations and Network Security.


Direct Reports: Technical and Support Teams in Region (Circa 5-10 incumbents)

Note: Region includes UK, Dubai, Qatar, India and Canada for IT support purposes.


Key Relationships: IT & Business Units, external vendors


Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and mentor the Systems, Network, End User Computing and Operational Integrations and Security Support Teams within region.
  • To work closely with the IT Strategy and Architecture function on business requirements so a clear and concise service strategy and design can be formulated and executed.
  • Engage with 3rd parties where necessary to operationally deliver solutions to meet business requirement and strategy.
  • Ensure that all infrastructure applications are managed, maintained and documented to guarantee agreed service levels are met.
  • Through the Team and with own knowledge and skills provide technical expertise to all business as usual activities and IT projects, ensuring that industry best practices are followed.
  • Maintain relevant relationship with key external vendors
  • Adhere to infrastructure policies and procedures (e.g. Change and Availability management).

Education and Experience:

ESSENTIAL:

  • MCSA: Windows Server 2008 or 2012 or 2016
  • ITIL V3/4 Foundation Certification

DESIRABLE:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Information Technology
  • Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE)
  • Citrix Certified Associate (CCA) for Citrix XenApp and XenDesktop 7
  • Citrix Certified Professional – Virtualization (CCP-V) for XenApp/XenDesktop 7.x
  • VMware certified Professional (VCP5) or Higher
  • Commvault Certified Professional
  • Nutanix Platform Professional Certification.

Experience

ESSENTIAL:

  • 6+ years corporate IT experience in complex multi-server, multi-site, multi-domain environments.
  • 6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Core Services (DNS, DHCP, DFS-R, etc.)
  • 6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Directory Services (Group Policy management, Configuration, Scripting)
  • 6+ experience in supporting systems infrastructure. (Systems, Storage, Networks, Virtualization)
  • 4+ years' experience in medium to large size Citrix environments (XenApp 6.x, 7.x)
  • 3+ years' experience in Microsoft Exchange 2010/2013/2016.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Remote Desktop Services 2008/2012/2012R2
  • Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server products
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Operating Systems (Server & Desktop)
  • Knowledge of Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager and Operation Manager (SCCM/SCOM).
  • Experience in managing and supporting Microsoft Azure and Office365 services.
  • Knowledge of data protection and disaster recovery solutions.
  • Knowledge of Virtualized Environments (vSphere, Hyper-V and XenServer)
  • Knowledge of networking fundamentals (OSI Layers/Addressing/ Switching/Routing).
  • Knowledge of security fundamentals (Confidentiality/Integrity/Availability/AAA/Security Policies)

DESIRABLE:


  • Knowledge of SAN and HCI Infrastructure (NetApp, Dell, Nutanix)
  • Knowledge of Server management platforms (HP SIM, Dell OpenManage)
  • Scripting skills (Powershell, VBScript, JavaScript)
  • Hands on experience on Commvault Backup.
  • Working knowledge of Networking environments Including: Configuration, Installation, Supporting & Diagnosing
  • Cisco Routers and Switches.
  • Cisco Wireless Access points

data.contentHTML:
Multiplex is a premier, global construction company, shaping skylines and delivering iconic projects for over 55 years.

At our best bringing large-scale and complex structures to life, our construction expertise stretches across the entire property sector.

Our work to date of current and completed projects comprises more than 1000 jobs with a combined value of more than $80 billion, and the financial strength and global relationships of our parent company Brookfield continues to drive our growth today.

We are focused on achieving long term, steady growth while transcending industry standards in safety, efficiency and quality.

Based at Head Office and reporting to the Head of Technology – Infrastructure and Applications, the primary responsibility of this role is to provide Global Technical and Operational team leadership and to assist with the design and implementation of IT systems to drive business results.
Secondary responsibilities involve bringing efficiencies in IT operations to help streamline system and application delivery in line with business objectives. These systems should provide the customers at large with an excellent user experience with systems scaled to achieve the strategic objectives of the business. This role will have active input into IT service strategy, design, transition and operations and will lead the delivery of IT Technical Operations Globally including (Infrastructure, Network, End User Computing, Site setup projects and Operational Integrations and Security).

Financial / Operations / Customer / People

  • Lead Technical Operations Managers in carrying out their duties providing guidance and support as required
  • Provide support and guidance and oversee activities of the Systems, Network and End User Computing Support Teams
  • Work closely with the IT Strategy and Architecture function to understand business requirements ensuring smooth transition of services into live operations
  • Work closely with project managers throughout the lifecycle of technology projects. Delegate technical responsibilities amongst the technical team and monitor progress of projects
  • Engage and maintain relevant relationships with technical vendors and 3rd parties to operationally deliver solutions to meet business requirement and strategy
  • Ensure that all infrastructure applications are managed, maintained and documented to guarantee agreed service levels are met
  • Through the Team provide technical expertise to all business as usual activities and IT projects, ensuring that industry best practices are followed
  • Act as Technical Advisory Board Approver delegating to Technical Operations Managers where appropriate
  • Adhere to infrastructure policies and procedures (e.g. Change and Availability management)
  • Provide training and support to any team members to share in vision goals and direction of business as well as direction on supporting and managing the ICT landscape where required
Essential:
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Information Technology or computer science.
  • MCSA: Windows Server 2008 or 2012 or 2016
  • ITIL V3/4 Foundation Certification
  • 6+ years corporate IT experience in complex multi-server, multi-site, multi-domain environments
  • 6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Core Services (DNS, DHCP, DFS-R, etc.)
  • 6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Directory Services (Group Policy management, Configuration, Scripting)
  • 6+ experience in supporting systems infrastructure. (Systems, Storage, Networks, Virtualization)
  • 4+ years' experience in medium to large size Citrix environments (XenApp 6.x, 7.x)
  • 3+ years' experience in Microsoft Exchange 2010/2013/2016
  • 3+ years' experience in managing and supporting Microsoft Azure and Office365 services
  • 3+ years' experience in team management, performance tracking, team development, etc.
  • Ability to work in a high-pressure, deadline-driven environment across multi time zones
  • Exceptional communication and reporting skills
  • Outstanding leadership skills and ability to delegate responsibilities effectively
  • Experience in working within ITIL & Project Methodology process driven environments
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Remote Desktop Services 2008/2012/2012R2
  • Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server products
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Operating Systems (Server & Desktop)
  • Knowledge of Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager and Operation Manager (SCCM/SCOM).
  • Experience in managing and supporting Microsoft Azure and Office365 services.
  • Knowledge of data protection and disaster recovery solutions.
  • Knowledge of Virtualized Environments (vSphere, Hyper-V and XenServer)
  • Knowledge of networking fundamentals (OSI Layers/Addressing/ Switching/Routing)
  • Knowledge of security fundamentals (Confidentiality/Integrity/Availability/AAA/Security Policies)
Desirable:
  • Knowledge of SAN and HCI Infrastructure (NetApp, Dell, Nutanix)
  • Knowledge of Server management platforms (HP SIM, Dell OpenManage)
  • Scripting skills (Powershell, VBScript, JavaScript)

data.contentHTML:
BrightTALK's SaaS platform is the best place for professionals and businesses to connect, learn and grow through shared knowledge and insights.
We are looking for a talented, driven and naturally curious Technical Support Associate to join BrightTALK's high performing Support Team to deliver live chat support to our clients, solve help-desk tickets and escalated issues with our development team, deliver custom integration projects and assist with the delivery of custom client reports. This is a great opportunity for a new graduate looking to start in business and tech operations.

The Technical Support Associate contributes to our coverage during APAC business hours and must be comfortable communicating (email, text-based chat applications and phone) with employees, clients and end-users - BrightTALK's audience of 7 million business professionals! The ideal candidate is able to apply methodical approaches to resolving technical issues within the pressures of a live broadcast environment.

The Technical Support Associate role requires strong analytical, communication and problem-solving skills involving a wide range of activities. A level of international travel will be required, especially during training.

Responsibilities

  • Provide the first line of technical support for BrightTALK clients and their presenters, our end-users and our employees
  • Deliver live chat support
  • Identify and resolve quality of service issues across our platform
  • Work closely with our Denver, London and New York City offices to coordinate daily activity
  • Assist the Operations team with monitoring the BrightTALK platform
  • Assist the Customer Success and Sales Teams with client support
  • Interact and troubleshoot with our clients and their presenters via a live text-based chat environment in the run-up to and during a live broadcast
  • Facilitate setup and delivery of certain custom events
  • Liaising with tier-1 and tier-2 technical support
  • Administer the platform by managing users and configuring back-end settings
  • Provide feedback on improvements to the platform and our support processes
  • Assist internal BrightTALK teams with technical platform support
  • Building and maintaining a strong technical understanding of our products and services
  • Assisting and facilitating certain business elements tracking in Salesforce
  • Administer cloud services e.g. Google Apps such as Mail, Calendars, Groups, Hangouts, etc.
  • Others duties as assigned

Skills and Experience Required

  • Strong knowledge of computers and web technology
  • Strong communication and organizational skills
  • Familiarity with Zoom.us, Slack or other meeting/collaboration software

Skills and Experience Preferred

  • Live event support, customer support or desktop support experience
  • Previous experience in a technical support and/or customer support role
  • Familiarity with web-based and technical languages (JavaScript, SQL, PHP, etc.)
  • Experience with Zendesk, Salesforce, Marketo or Intercom

Why we like working at BrightTALK

  • Friendly, talented, collaborative and entrepreneurial teams.
  • Generous and comprehensive benefits.
  • Generous holiday policy, flexible schedule.
  • Offices located in top destination cities.
  • Training allowance and regular innovation days.
  • Team building and volunteer opportunities.
  • Career pathing and mentorship opportunities.
BrightTALK brings professionals and businesses together to learn and grow. Over 7 million professionals engage with 75,000 free talks and 1,000 online summits to discover new technologies, learn from trusted experts and grow their careers. Thousands of businesses acquire and inspire their ideal audience with BrightTALK's AI-powered content and demand marketing platform.

We are dedicated to learning and growing, going after big dreams, taking ownership, remaining open and honest while recognizing we are all in it together. We believe this starts within our own team, and from this place, we can invite people all over the world to join. We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their passion to help us build a world changing audience and thrive along the way. Join BrightTALK to collaborate with an engaged team, working together to provide learning and growth opportunity for all.

BrightTALK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

About the Role:
The Principal Engineers will be a part of methods and agile and apply user-centered design and extreme programming principles and use cutting-edge technologies that give our team the ability to release early and often to ensure the customer is at the core of everything.

About the Role:
The Principal Engineers will be a part of methods and agile and apply user-centered design and extreme programming principles and use cutting-edge technologies that give our team the ability to release early and often to ensure the customer is at the core of everything.

To be considered you will have the following skills/experience:

Have built quality applications in at least one programming language

Know how to communicate to unblock work across teams using Agile best practices

Build applications using Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

Help drive adoption and maintenance of best practices in your team

Mentor junior team members using a growth mindset approach

Full Stack .NET Developer | Transformation & Greenfield solutions | Permanent | Based out of their offices in the stunning Byron Bay, NSW.

The Company

Nationally established Australian founded SaaS company
In-house technology development & solutions
Modern Microsoft & Azure driven environment
Sociable & performance driven business culture
Located in one of Australia's most desirable towns, Byron Bay NSW

The Role

Core platform / end to end full stack solution builds
Integration solutions & API Development
Database design and development | SQL Server
Responsive development
Gathering requirements | Stakeholder engagement
Play a critical role in ensuring the successful delivery of quality-crafted solutions

Your Skills & Experience

Degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering or related field.
Proven experience with end to end software & web development projects
Strong experience in . NET, .NET Core, C#, Angular, & Web Services Development
Familiar with SQL Server - stored procedures
Experience with integrating with API backends
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Azure
Customer experience mind-set
Problem solving skills | Solutions focused
Clear and effective communication style
Team player
Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team-oriented environment
Unlimited Full-Working Rights in Australia with the ability to relocate to Byron Bay (if you don't already live within the area).

About you

You have brilliant technical skills and consider yourself an authority on best coding practices and how reliable products should be built. You have the creative flair to deliver innovative solutions and the business insights to know what will work. You are highly collaborative and a true team colleague, and your exceptional communication skills let you convey complex ideas to a non-technical business-users.

What's on offer?

A fast-paced work environment backed by a motivated and energized team of Software professionals.
A company on a growth path offering extensive opportunities to grow your skill set and career potential.
The rewards of a role where you will be challenged every single day
A workplace where work-life balance is actively promoted.

Robert Half Ltd is committed to equal opportunity and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of categories protected under local law.

data.contentHTML:
Solutions Architect

As the e-Commerce resurrection continues, imagine being part of a movement that not only enhances your online shopping experience, but also allows you to give back while doing so.

This innovative Fintech is redefining the shopping experience and in doing so, has a need for an experienced Solutions Architect/Consultant to join the team.

This is not your everyday Solutions Architect role and will require you to (initially) jump into and understand a complex code base. Once you have established what works and what doesn't, the next phase of your role will see you migrate the existing web and mobile architecture from Angular/native mobile to React/React Native. Then the fun starts!

The current tech stack is C#, .NETCORE, Angular, DynamoDB and PostgreSQL with a very heavy reliance on AWS on a monolithic platform. The future stack will rely heavily on React/React Native, (even more) AWS, and a DevOps mindset in a newly built microserviced architecture.

This role will be great for a hands on Solutions Architect who still enjoys coding, but who is ready to take responsibility of their own environment. On top of fantastic technical skills, we will need you to have excellent documentation experience, great leaderships skills and an ability to present your ideas and findings to an executive leadership team (including Founder and the Board).

For a more detailed overview of the role, company and opportunity, please reach out to me for more details. sean@theonset.com.au / 0407 932 548.

data.contentHTML:
Our client a leading Financial Services organisation urgently seeks an experienced Kubernetes Infrastructure Engineer with a strong background in building & supporting on-prem Kubernetes Container Infrastructure [on VMware]. You must also have experience in the deployment and support of Kubernetes on Public Cloud [GCP and or AWS].

As part of a small team covering a large portfolio of Infrastructure services, you’ll need proficiency in a broad range of technologies and deep expertise in a few them. The team covers the following set of technologies:
Cloud (AWS, Google), Virtualisation (VMware) and Containerisation (Kubernetes, Docker)
Automation of Linux and Windows OS deployment, configuration and management
Core infrastructure protocols across compute (x86), networking (IP based) and storage (block, file, and object)
Orchestration of HTTP based APIs / leveraging Cloud provider SDKs
Proficiency with at least 2 of the following: bash, PowerShell, Python, Go, node.js
Good understanding of VMware NSX-T network virtualization stack
Experience working with VMware PKS is an advantage
Excellent communication, presentation skills with a can-do attitude. If you have the requested skills and experiences required then please apply NOW or call 02 9037 0337 discuss further

data.jobTitle: UiPath and Azure Automation Lead - Perth
data.contentHTML:
UiPath + Azure Delivery Lead - Perth

The client is an international consulting business that specialise in providing digital services and solutions to a variety of clients across Australia. They are looking to hire someone to lead the uiPath + Azure automation projects for clients down in Perth.

Great opportunity for a lead developer with proven RPA + Azure skills to relocate to beautiful Perth with a top tier consulting business.

You will be leading the engagements from a technical standpoint and have the opportunity to carve out a career and name for yourself in the RPA space in Perth. Perth is beautiful and a lot cheaper than Sydney and Melbourne!

Role Description

You will lead the delivery teams in the design and development (both onshore +offshore resources) of automation and cloud solutions to a variety of clients. You will be the domain specialist in the team for automation (uiPath) with the end goal of reducing cost for clients.




It's highly likely you will be involved in other solutions using Microsoft Azure so a background here is important to. From a soft skills side - you need to be comfortable leading a team, running projects and interfacing with clients.

Role Requirements

Non-technical

  • You need to have led onshore and offshore teams
  • You need to be very organised for the amount of project planning and estimation needed
  • Strong commercial, analytic and logical approach - you're not just there to code an RPA solution - the end goal is to achieve efficiency and cost savings for the client
  • Influencing / networking skills - track record of interacting with client partners

Technical

  • Ideally you will have a consultancy background but this is not a deal breaker
  • 5+ years within application development, complex code development, application testing, component design
  • You need to have experience implementing uiPath - 2+ years
  • Strong programming background within C# and/or JavaScript
  • You need to have experience in Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services / Azure PaaS - ideally with certifications

If you're interested in finding out more please call 0468 473 427.

Please note only Australian residents or those with PR can apply for this job.


Sthree Australia is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Senior Developer - Cloud

  • One year contract
  • Based in Sydney CBD
  • Application development in Azure Cloud!

This role is responsible for ensuring the effective operation and use of a critical organisational system, web environment or suite of applications and interfacing systems. This role is responsible for the analysis, development and implementation of new systems and software to meet operational requirements.

The role acts as a technical lead in supporting interfaces and related systems and will perform the necessary system engineering tasks to maintain the application at peak performance

Essential technologies

  • Experience with application development on Azure Cloud
  • Familiarity with Azure Cloud native services
  • Sound understanding of Web application development technologies, including but not limited to HTML, CSS, Javascript Frameworks
  • Experience in relational database deployment and maintenance, especially Microsoft CDS and AzureSQL
  • CI/CD and DevOps methodologies
  • Azure DevOps experience
  • UX/CX knowledge and experience

Essential skills

  • Tertiary qualification in computing science, IT or related discipline supported by demonstrated experience in application, web development, server development and/or system support as relevant to the role.
  • Ability to work independently and reliably deliver on expected outcomes
  • Business analysis skills
  • Demonstrated knowledge of electrical supply networks.
  • Proven ability to present data and manipulate, convert and report on system information.
  • Strong organisation, prioritisation and time management skills.
  • Established interpersonal skills and experience in dealing with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Recognised analytical, problem solving and decision making skills.

To be eligible for this opportunity, you must be an Australian permanent resident or citizen as my client does not sponsor visas.

data.contentHTML:
Multiplex is a premier, global construction company, shaping skylines and delivering iconic projects for over 55 years.


At our best bringing large-scale and complex structures to life, our construction expertise stretches across the entire property sector.


Our work to date of current and completed projects comprises more than 1000 jobs with a combined value of more than $80 billion, and the financial strength and global relationships of our parent company Brookfield continues to drive our growth today.


We are focused on achieving long term, steady growth while transcending industry standards in safety, efficiency and quality.


Based at Head Office and reporting to the Head of Technology – Infrastructure and Applications, the primary responsibility of this role is to provide Global Technical and Operational team leadership and to assist with the design and implementation of IT systems to drive business results.

Secondary responsibilities involve bringing efficiencies in IT operations to help streamline system and application delivery in line with business objectives. These systems should provide the customers at large with an excellent user experience with systems scaled to achieve the strategic objectives of the business. This role will have active input into IT service strategy, design, transition and operations and will lead the delivery of IT Technical Operations Globally including (Infrastructure, Network, End User Computing, Site setup projects and Operational Integrations and Security).


Financial / Operations / Customer / People

  • Lead Technical Operations Managers in carrying out their duties providing guidance and support as required
  • Provide support and guidance and oversee activities of the Systems, Network and End User Computing Support Teams
  • Work closely with the IT Strategy and Architecture function to understand business requirements ensuring smooth transition of services into live operations
  • Work closely with project managers throughout the lifecycle of technology projects. Delegate technical responsibilities amongst the technical team and monitor progress of projects
  • Engage and maintain relevant relationships with technical vendors and 3rd parties to operationally deliver solutions to meet business requirement and strategy
  • Ensure that all infrastructure applications are managed, maintained and documented to guarantee agreed service levels are met
  • Through the Team provide technical expertise to all business as usual activities and IT projects, ensuring that industry best practices are followed
  • Act as Technical Advisory Board Approver delegating to Technical Operations Managers where appropriate
  • Adhere to infrastructure policies and procedures (e.g. Change and Availability management)
  • Provide training and support to any team members to share in vision goals and direction of business as well as direction on supporting and managing the ICT landscape where required

Essential:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Information Technology or computer science.
  • MCSA: Windows Server 2008 or 2012 or 2016
  • ITIL V3/4 Foundation Certification

  • 6+ years corporate IT experience in complex multi-server, multi-site, multi-domain environments
  • 6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Core Services (DNS, DHCP, DFS-R, etc.)
  • 6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Directory Services (Group Policy management, Configuration, Scripting)
  • 6+ experience in supporting systems infrastructure. (Systems, Storage, Networks, Virtualization)
  • 4+ years' experience in medium to large size Citrix environments (XenApp 6.x, 7.x)
  • 3+ years' experience in Microsoft Exchange 2010/2013/2016
  • 3+ years' experience in managing and supporting Microsoft Azure and Office365 services
  • 3+ years' experience in team management, performance tracking, team development, etc.
  • Ability to work in a high-pressure, deadline-driven environment across multi time zones
  • Exceptional communication and reporting skills
  • Outstanding leadership skills and ability to delegate responsibilities effectively
  • Experience in working within ITIL & Project Methodology process driven environments
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Remote Desktop Services 2008/2012/2012R2
  • Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server products
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Operating Systems (Server & Desktop)
  • Knowledge of Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager and Operation Manager (SCCM/SCOM).
  • Experience in managing and supporting Microsoft Azure and Office365 services.
  • Knowledge of data protection and disaster recovery solutions.
  • Knowledge of Virtualized Environments (vSphere, Hyper-V and XenServer)
  • Knowledge of networking fundamentals (OSI Layers/Addressing/ Switching/Routing)
  • Knowledge of security fundamentals (Confidentiality/Integrity/Availability/AAA/Security Policies)

Desirable:

  • Knowledge of SAN and HCI Infrastructure (NetApp, Dell, Nutanix)
  • Knowledge of Server management platforms (HP SIM, Dell OpenManage)
  • Scripting skills (Powershell, VBScript, JavaScript)
data.contentText:
Multiplex is a premier, global construction company, shaping skylines and delivering iconic projects for over 55 years.


At our best bringing large-scale and complex structures to life, our construction expertise stretches across the entire property sector.


Our work to date of current and completed projects comprises more than 1000 jobs with a combined value of more than $80 billion, and the financial strength and global relationships of our parent company Brookfield continues to drive our growth today.


We are focused on achieving long term, steady growth while transcending industry standards in safety, efficiency and quality.


Based at Head Office and reporting to the Head of Technology – Infrastructure and Applications, the primary responsibility of this role is to provide Global Technical and Operational team leadership and to assist with the design and implementation of IT systems to drive business results.

Secondary responsibilities involve bringing efficiencies in IT operations to help streamline system and application delivery in line with business objectives. These systems should provide the customers at large with an excellent user experience with systems scaled to achieve the strategic objectives of the business. This role will have active input into IT service strategy, design, transition and operations and will lead the delivery of IT Technical Operations Globally including (Infrastructure, Network, End User Computing, Site setup projects and Operational Integrations and Security).


Financial / Operations / Customer / People

Lead Technical Operations Managers in carrying out their duties providing guidance and support as required
Provide support and guidance and oversee activities of the Systems, Network and End User Computing Support Teams
Work closely with the IT Strategy and Architecture function to understand business requirements ensuring smooth transition of services into live operations
Work closely with project managers throughout the lifecycle of technology projects. Delegate technical responsibilities amongst the technical team and monitor progress of projects
Engage and maintain relevant relationships with technical vendors and 3rd parties to operationally deliver solutions to meet business requirement and strategy
Ensure that all infrastructure applications are managed, maintained and documented to guarantee agreed service levels are met
Through the Team provide technical expertise to all business as usual activities and IT projects, ensuring that industry best practices are followed
Act as Technical Advisory Board Approver delegating to Technical Operations Managers where appropriate
Adhere to infrastructure policies and procedures (e.g. Change and Availability management)
Provide training and support to any team members to share in vision goals and direction of business as well as direction on supporting and managing the ICT landscape where required


Essential:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Information Technology or computer science.
MCSA: Windows Server 2008 or 2012 or 2016

6+ years corporate IT experience in complex multi-server, multi-site, multi-domain environments
6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Core Services (DNS, DHCP, DFS-R, etc.)
6+ years Windows 2008/2012/2016 Directory Services (Group Policy management, Configuration, Scripting)
6+ experience in supporting systems infrastructure. (Systems, Storage, Networks, Virtualization)

Exceptional communication and reporting skills

data.contentHTML:
BrightTALK's SaaS platform is the best place for professionals and businesses to connect, learn and grow through shared knowledge and insights.
We are looking for a talented, driven and naturally curious Technical Support Associate to join BrightTALK's high performing Support Team to deliver live chat support to our clients, solve help-desk tickets and escalated issues with our development team, deliver custom integration projects and assist with the delivery of custom client reports. This is a great opportunity for a new graduate looking to start in business and tech operations.

The Technical Support Associate contributes to our coverage during APAC business hours and must be comfortable communicating (email, text-based chat applications and phone) with employees, clients and end-users - BrightTALK's audience of 7 million business professionals! The ideal candidate is able to apply methodical approaches to resolving technical issues within the pressures of a live broadcast environment.

The Technical Support Associate role requires strong analytical, communication and problem-solving skills involving a wide range of activities. A level of international travel will be required, especially during training.

Responsibilities

  • Provide the first line of technical support for BrightTALK clients and their presenters, our end-users and our employees
  • Deliver live chat support
  • Identify and resolve quality of service issues across our platform
  • Work closely with our Denver, London and New York City offices to coordinate daily activity
  • Assist the Operations team with monitoring the BrightTALK platform
  • Assist the Customer Success and Sales Teams with client support
  • Interact and troubleshoot with our clients and their presenters via a live text-based chat environment in the run-up to and during a live broadcast
  • Facilitate setup and delivery of certain custom events
  • Liaising with tier-1 and tier-2 technical support
  • Administer the platform by managing users and configuring back-end settings
  • Provide feedback on improvements to the platform and our support processes
  • Assist internal BrightTALK teams with technical platform support
  • Building and maintaining a strong technical understanding of our products and services
  • Assisting and facilitating certain business elements tracking in Salesforce
  • Administer cloud services e.g. Google Apps such as Mail, Calendars, Groups, Hangouts, etc.
  • Others duties as assigned

Skills and Experience Required

  • Strong knowledge of computers and web technology
  • Strong communication and organizational skills
  • Familiarity with Zoom.us, Slack or other meeting/collaboration software

Skills and Experience Preferred

  • Live event support, customer support or desktop support experience
  • Previous experience in a technical support and/or customer support role
  • Familiarity with web-based and technical languages (JavaScript, SQL, PHP, etc.)
  • Experience with Zendesk, Salesforce, Marketo or Intercom

Why we like working at BrightTALK

  • Friendly, talented, collaborative and entrepreneurial teams.
  • Generous and comprehensive benefits.
  • Generous holiday policy, flexible schedule.
  • Offices located in top destination cities.
  • Training allowance and regular innovation days.
  • Team building and volunteer opportunities.
  • Career pathing and mentorship opportunities.
BrightTALK brings professionals and businesses together to learn and grow. Over 7 million professionals engage with 75,000 free talks and 1,000 online summits to discover new technologies, learn from trusted experts and grow their careers. Thousands of businesses acquire and inspire their ideal audience with BrightTALK's AI-powered content and demand marketing platform.

We are dedicated to learning and growing, going after big dreams, taking ownership, remaining open and honest while recognizing we are all in it together. We believe this starts within our own team, and from this place, we can invite people all over the world to join. We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their passion to help us build a world changing audience and thrive along the way. Join BrightTALK to collaborate with an engaged team, working together to provide learning and growth opportunity for all.

BrightTALK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

data.contentHTML:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 459,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

We are expanding our Operations Architecture Team, so looking for Splunk Consultants and Managers to lead the design and implementation of build, release and deployment of enterprise Operational applications following the SDLC and Agile and or /Waterfall methodology. This role will require developing and building quality operational platforms and frameworks to allow consistent, traceable operational management of application and infrastructure components across Non-Prod and Production environments.
Salary range as AUD 60K-100K.
The role:
  • A full stack engineer developing and delivering solution end to end from design through the delivery.
  • Build, Develop and support operational capability in order to provision environments by utilising and creating innovative tools
  • Duties include automation of installation/configuration/management of Splunk 6.x, ELK, App Dynamics, New Relic, Icinga, Nagios, Apache, node.js applications in a secure deployment
  • Responsible for creating an automated capability to patch and manage Windows and Linux (RHEL/CentOS) operating systems
  • Responsible for creating/versioning/testing of scripts (Bash, PowerShell), AWS Cloud Formation templates, Chef, Nagios, Maven/Ant, Git, Jenkins, Perl, and Ruby to achieve a high-level of automation
  • Troubleshoot dev, test and production environment events/issues, including cloud infrastructure and application components
  • UX development using React, Angular.js or Node.js

Key Criteria:
  • At least 12 months Deployment and management of JAVA, ANT Scripts, J2EE, PHP and .NET based multi-tier application deployments across cloud platforms
  • At least 2 years development experience including bash/shell scripting or any development language
  • At least 1 year of Development experience with React, Angular.js or Node.js
  • Deployed Splunk and/or other Operational monitoring tools
  • Familiarity with RDBMS (Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server)
  • Network experience with route tables, access control lists, firewalls, NAT, HTTP, Load Balancers, DNS, IP and firewall configuration
  • Knowledge of REST Web Services, XML and JSON
  • Experience with orchestration/provisioning with Chef/Puppet and Jenkins
Please know this requisition better through https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qGB8LfFDc2I

About Accenture
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. We combine unmatched experience and specialised capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. With 505,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

data.contentHTML:
Our client is looking for a Senior Analyst Developer who will be responsible for ensuring the effective operation and use of their critical organisational system, web environment or suite of applications and interfacing systems.

Our client is looking for a Senior Analyst Developer who will be responsible for ensuring the effective operation and use of their critical organisational system, web environment or suite of applications and interfacing systems.
As an experienced Senior Analyst Developer you will be responsible for the analysis, development and implementation of new systems and software to meet operational requirements.

The role acts as a technical lead in supporting interfaces and related systems and you will be performing the necessary system engineering tasks to maintain the application at peak performance.

What you will do:
Ensuring effective system performance through consulting with the business and performing activities to effectively maintain a sound environment such as testing, patching, upgrades, data modelling and coding.

Delivering effective work planning and process improvement to increase productivity from system use on an ongoing basis.

Designing and developing innovative technical and process solutions to meet business requirements and resolve problems/incidents related to the system and its relationships with other systems.

Providing subject matter expertise in the relevant system for needs analysis, options and program development in order to optimally enhance and maintain the suite of applications.

Participating in (and/or managing) projects related to system, process and business improvements.

Managing relationships with vendors related to system requirements and enhancements.

Essential Experience

Experience with application development on Azure Cloud

Familiarity with Azure Cloud native services

Sound understanding of Web application development technologies, including but not limited to HTML, CSS, Javascript Frameworks

Experience in relational database deployment and maintenance, especially Microsoft CDS and AzureSQL

CI/CD and DevOps methodologies

Azure DevOps experience

Business analysis skills

UX/CX knowledge and experience

If you looking for your next career move, click on the link below to apply or call Shayal Chandra on 0415 042 457 for a confidential discussion.

data.contentHTML:
Candidates should possess good troubleshooting and reasoning skills, strong written and verbal communication skills, desire to work on networking, security, web, and other server-client technologies.

This is a mid-level role – We are looking for someone with a few years of experience under their belt. As well, a strong appetite for assisting customers with deploying and supporting our world-class solutions.
Responsibilities:

  • Primarily be responsible for deployment and technical support of our customers.
  • Able to troubleshoot complex communication between clients and servers infrastructures on the fly.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, work with senior engineers to help resolve issues
  • Comfortable with writing a few technical articles now and then to assist with growing both our internal and public-facing knowledgebase.
  • Able to handle and cope with stressful situations and understands the pressures of a start-up environment.
  • Eagerness to learn lots of new technologies

Requirements:

  • Proficient with troubleshooting a wide variety of applications using common tools
  • Experience with typical client and server operating systems as a user and/or Administrator (Windows, Linux, iOS, MacOS, Android.)
  • Familiar with reading and/or writing simple code is a bonus – preferably in the area of Python, Javascript and/or PHP.
  • Minimum of Bachelor’s degree is preferred.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience working for a SaaS provider

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • Client Facing Software Support: 1 year (Required)
  • Linux: 2 years (Required)

Location:

  • Sydney NSW (Required)

Language:

  • English (Required)

Work Eligibility:

  • The candidate can work temporarily with no restriction on hours (Required)

data.contentHTML:
Our vertical SaaS platform transforms the way Construction Head Contractor's, Subcontractors, Owners, and Consultants connect and manage the construction bidding and project management processes throughout the Design, Pre-Construction & Construction Phases.

We focus on creating simple to learn and beautiful looking software that people love to use. With offices in Sydney and the US, we are a young and fast-growing business looking for people who enjoy a challenge.

We are currently seeking a talented front-end software developer to join our in-house development team located in North Sydney to assist with the planning and implementation of new features and upgrades in a fast-paced agile environment.

The successful applicant will have previously worked on MVC platforms and mobile app interfaces with a minimum experience of 5 years. We are looking for people who can think outside the box and help us create a unique user experience for our clients.

You must have the drive to succeed and take pride in your work.

Required Experience, Skills and Qualifications

Skills Required:

  • HTML 5 / CSS 3 / SASS
  • JavaScript / Typescript
  • Angular.js (v1)
  • React with Typescript
  • PHP
  • node.js
  • Webpack
  • Strategic Programming
  • Agile experience (JIRA)

Bonus development skills:

  • AWS EC2/S3
  • Docker/Kubernetes
  • Experience with leaflet.js
  • Experience with Android/iOS applications

Job Type and Category

Perks & More:

  • Supportive, thoughtful, and inspiring team and environment
  • A path to a leadership position
  • Stocked kitchens with plenty of drink and snack options
  • Flexible PTO and sick leave- take a break when you need
  • Our office is 5 mins walk from North Sydney station

Company Profile

WeBuild provides a cloud-based construction management platform that empowers construction professionals to manage projects more efficiently, reduce project risks, and keep all project stakeholders connected without barriers.

If you believe that you have the necessary technical skills, determination, and drive, contact us by sending your CV. You must be located in Sydney and have the right to work in Australia on a full-time basis.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Looking to develop a new mobile application for marketplace startup. The app will be for price comparison for car manufacturers and reseller marketing specialists to target local buyers. The app will be used by people willing to sell or buy new and/or used cars.

We have a team of back-end developers who have created the APIs for our application. We are looking for a front-end developer with a great knowledge and proven experience of iOS & Android App development. Knowledge and experience of working with Flutter.dve, Html5 and CSS3 and JS frameworks such as React, Angular or VUE.JS would be a plus.

Apply directly with your portfolio at: https://prolancer.com/jobs/send-proposal/294

Benefits:

  • Work from home opportunities
  • Flexible working hours

Contract length: 6 months

Job Types: Temporary, Contract

Salary: $50,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • development: 3 years (Preferred)

data.contentHTML:
As a Junior Developer at The Works, you will be responsible for the development of a broad range of innovative projects, from messenger bots and websites, through to eDM’s and mobile apps. You will work closely with our Technical Director, Digital Producers and other key stakeholders, to plan and deliver exciting technical projects.

This is a great opportunity for a recent graduate or a junior developer looking to move into a creative agency.

Main Duties

  • Development across a range of projects including responsive websites and EDM’s
  • Translation of UI/UX wireframes to code
  • Integration of the front-end and back-end aspects of web applications
  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Implementation of security and data protection

Desired Skills and Qualifications

  • Must be able to build a mobile first webpage and responsive EDM
  • Must have technical capability in: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Node JS and React JS
  • Experience using Docker and/or GIT would be a bonus
  • Ability to implement automated testing platforms and unit tests
  • Basic Photoshop & Sketch skills
  • Ability to translate technical requirements to suit different audiences and technical understanding
  • Displays a passion and keeps up to date with the latest development trends and techniques

data.contentHTML:
Who we are

Our unique platform-as-as-service enables game developers to easily create and operate marketplaces where players can then buy, sell and trade “in-game assets” (e.g., skins, weapons and tools) with each other. By leveraging the Ethereum Blockchain, for the first time ever, players have true ownership and control over their in-game assets.

We are backed by top-tier investors including Naspers Ventures, Galaxy Digital, Apex Capital and Coinbase. With US$15m raised in venture funding, and over US$6m in revenue from our genesis sale we are very well positioned to leverage our first-mover advantage globally and make ownership of in-game assets go mainstream.

Our first title, Gods Unchained, is already the number one blockchain game in terms of players, revenue and secondary asset trading. In fact, Gods Unchained has issued more in-game assets than all other blockchain games, put together.. More games are set to join the platform in 2020.

That's where you come in...

The Senior Full Stack Engineer (integrations) who will be responsible for leading, designing and implementing all engineering needs for the Publishing department. You will have three primary roles for each new game that we launch:

- Website: Build a high quality website to promote the launch of a new game.
- Backend integration: Build a custom backend which integrates with our platform to implement game-specific functionality. Work with 3rd party developers to ensure items in-game match blockchain records, and to display other blockchain related information.
- Smart Contracts: Write the necessary smart contracts for each game.

Technology stack
We don’t need you to know anything about the blockchain (though it helps): we have in-house experts who can teach you everything you need to know about Ethereum. We do need to you be able to work with our standard stack to help others maintain your work:
- On the frontend, either of Angular 2+ or React, with strong CSS/SASS skills
- On the backend, either of Golang or Node.js

Day-to-day Job description

  • Create full stack technical designs based on game design requirements
  • Build and maintain complex full stack applications
  • Write reusable, scalable, testable and efficient code
  • Participate in team planning and design sessions
  • Form a bridge between our platform team and external game developers

Why Join Us

  • Impact - Be at the frontier of blockchain gaming and fundamentally change the relationship between gamers and developers.
  • Development opportunities - Have full ownership and accountability for engineering in the Publishing team, and learn more about blockchain engineering and game development.
  • Career progression - Be the first engineering hire in a fast growing team, with the opportunity to own products from end to end and lead in future
  • Team culture - Be part of a fun, energetic and high-drive team

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $130,000.00 to $150,000.00 /year

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

data.contentHTML:
BigCommerce is disrupting the e-commerce industry as the SaaS leader for fast- growing, mid-market businesses. We enable our customers to build intuitive and engaging stores to support every stage of their growth.

Named a "Great Place to Work" in Australia in 2019, BigCommerce is looking for a full-time Technical Support Representative for our Sydney Office to support our customers' technical issues, educate our store owners on various platform features, and enable our customers to sell more and grow their online stores.

At BigCommerce, we don't just sell and support a platform, we empower our clients to succeed. You will use your technical know-how and unparalleled customer service skills to help our customers set-up, optimize, and run their online stores by answering technical-related questions via our phone, chat, and ticketing systems. Our team members are expected to learn the basics of the job quickly, and to continue growing their knowledge of the industry as it evolves. You are a team player who can recognize the various values and opportunities presented by your peers, you will work with them, compete against them, and celebrate each other's success. The right candidate will possess strong technical skills, the ability to communicate effectively via unsurpassed soft skills, and the creativity to engineer solutions for the ever growing world of eCommerce entrepreneurs. As a team, our mission is to make ourselves available when our customers need us and to give them a path to success. We offer competitive pay and have an onboarding period with ongoing training and development.

What You Will Do

  • Provide extraordinary support to our ever-growing merchant base with your unsurpassed customer service and problem solving capabilities
  • Work front line web cases, flexing to chats and/or phone calls as needed.
  • Develop solutions and utilise standard operating procedures for improving customer satisfaction and creating lifelong promoters of our brand
  • Work cross-functionally with local business units to triage urgent support issues and solve or escalate issues as needed; escalate unresolved issues as required while maintaining ownership of issues through resolution
  • Decrease incoming volume by striving toward first contact resolution and proactively onboarding and advising customers on eCommerce best practices
  • Assist customers with common billing, invoice, and account issues
  • Utilise classroom, video, and self-paced training to stay ahead of product advancements and eCommerce best practices; utilise your knowledge to solve problems efficiently
  • Display high levels of professionalism and recurring interactions with departments inside and outside of the Client Success organization.
Who You Are

  • A work ethic that demonstrates dedication to the company, its mission, personal pride, and the team; a desire to work in a culture of excellence
  • Experience in a customer-facing, service-oriented role is required
  • Experience in a phone, email, or chat-based technical support or customer service contact center preferred
  • Exceptional ability to utilise self service resources (internal guides, Google-fu, external service portals, Stack Overflow, etc) to find solutions is required
  • Strong aptitude toward various web, e-commerce, and hosting technologies and how they work together is required
  • Ability to read or edit within at least one web-based language (HTML, CSS, Javascript, Jquery, etc) is preferred
  • Understanding of basic data structures preferred
  • Exceptional critical thinking and soft skills with experience in de-escalating difficult customers
  • A passion for WOWing customers and providing often unique solutions to best fit each customer's situation
  • Dedicated team player interested in growing and competing alongside some of the best tech support agents in the business, willingness to help others grow and seek help from peers to maximize potential
  • Excellent written communication skills for documenting calls and platform issues as well as excellent verbal communication and the ability to deal with frustrated clients without taking it personal, and strong customer relationship skills
This description is intended to serve as a summary of key duties and responsibilities and may not contain a comprehensive list of activities.

Diversity & Inclusion at BigCommerce
We have the opportunity to build not only a great business, but a great company, with soul. Our beliefs and commitment to diversity and inclusion are a central part of achieving that.

Our dedication to diversity and inclusion is grounded in two things: a moral belief in the dignity, value, and potential of every individual, and a practical belief that diverse, inclusive teams will create the best outcomes for our customers, partners, employees, and company. We welcome everyone to be a part of our journey. ( https://pages.beamery.com/bigcommerce/page/diversityandinclusion )

Current BigCommerce Employees: Please use the internal job board ( ../../internal_job_board ) to apply for openings

( https://pages.beamery.com/bigcommerce/page/bignetwork )

Posted on 21 April 2020

data.jobTitle: Mid - Senior Level Full Stack Engineer (React / Node)
data.contentHTML:
One of our key clients is looking for a full stack engineer to join the team and help them build an exciting new greenfield product.

They develop end to end solutions building bespoke platforms using cutting-edge technologies and are very passionate about code quality.

Their main technologies include:
  • Frontend: ReactJS
  • Backend: NodeJS / GraphQL
  • Mobile Apps: React Native / Flutter
Their main tools are:
  • Jira
  • Github
  • Slack
As a full stack software engineer, you will be working with their passionate development team on best development practices, best code quality standards and DevOps.

We are on the hunt for someone who is down-to-earth, deeply cares about what they do and wants to make an impact in everything we build.

What will be expected;
  • You care about your work
  • You are a Team Player
  • You are Accountable
  • You like to learn new tech and love pushing the boundaries
  • You know how to scope projects accurately
  • Can-do attitude
  • Great communication
  • Attention to details
  • Quick Learner
  • Provide updates & project status' when required
Why You Should Join:
  • Small team
  • Flat hierarchy
  • Snacks and drinks on us
  • Be part of a growing company with a strong reputation
  • Work closely with leading brands and up-and-coming startups
  • Y-Combinator Graduates
Must Have Experience
  • Javascript with ES6 standards
  • Typescript
  • Testing Framework (Jest or others)
  • React.js / React Native
  • Node.js
  • SequelizeJS
  • GraphQL
  • Database design / architecture
  • Serverless Framework
  • Microservices
  • CI
Nice To Have Experience
  • DevOps Experience
  • ReasonML
  • AWS / Azure / GCP
If you are interested in this role make sure you APPLY NOW before it's too late.

data.contentHTML:
Job description

Here at Innovate Automotive, we are on a mission to enable our customers to provide a new, customer-led business model to millions of Australians - Car Subscription. We are building a B2B Software-As-A-Service (SaaS) platform that equips our customers across the full subscription lifecycle and takes the pain and complexity out of providing a subscription service.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Software Engineer with a growth mindset to join our expanding team and help us achieve our mission - all while working with modern, best-in-class technology partners such as AWS, Auth0 and Twilio. Based in Sydney and as part of an outcome-focussed product and engineering team, you will have the opportunity to make a real impact while enjoying the autonomy that comes with clarity of mission and purpose.

What do our Software Engineers do?

  • Understand the business and create solutions to solve business problems
  • Collaborate, learn from, mentor and coach your peers
  • Write clean, scalable and maintainable code
  • Communicate clearly - both verbally and written so that context is appropriately set
  • Possess a desire to grow personally and professionally

What would we like you to bring to the team?

  • Software engineering expertise in either PHP (Laravel), Vue JS or both
  • Have a working understanding of software architecture and best practice
  • Be able to pick up new technologies, ways of working and soft skills
  • Be open to change and with a growth mindset

Why join Innovate Automotive?

You get the opportunity to join a company that is growing rapidly and with an excellent customer base.

With a growing customer base, the opportunity to grow professionally and take on more responsibility also becomes a possibility sooner than at more mature companies. We will provide you all the tools you need to succeed and ongoing training to ensure you are able to perform the role to the highest level. You will be surrounded by a supportive, dynamic and fun team and will be rewarded and recognised for your hard work.

If you have the right credentials and a positive attitude, please apply now and we look forward to hearing from you.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $80,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • PHP: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Eligibility:

  • The candidate can work permanently with no restriction on hours (Preferred)

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

data.jobTitle: Senior Level - Full Stack .Net - Azure - Angular
data.contentHTML:
• Insurance Domain
  • Long Term Contract - Up to $650 per day - extensions
  • Greenfield Projects - No Legacy Code


Full Stack .Net
Must have worked on Angular and Azure

About the Company
Our client are a National award winning workplace, that have been recognised for their great culture that incorporates further learning, digital innovation, and above all an environment that inspires.

The Team
You'll be joining a small team of 8 Senior .Net Dev's, part of a larger development group of 25+. They are looking for developers to really kick start there project. They are collaborative, enjoy problem solving and love learning.

The Gig
They are looking for a senior level - Full Stack .Net developer to join their fast paced agile team for an initial 6 month contract, however the project has about 18 months to run. You will need to be eager to learn and motivated to succeed. In return you will get the opportunity to work alongside the best in the business. You must be the kind of person who dives head first into interesting challenges and relishes being part of a fast paced environment.

About You
You'll come from a true Full Stack Background and you'll take pride in the code that you produce. You'll be a best practice enthusiast, however you definitively know when to drop the quest for perfection due to commercial realities. You are flexible in approach, and can listen to colleagues and respect other people's ideas.

Your KEY SKILLS
  • C# / ASP.Net MVC5 + / .NET framework
  • API's
  • SQL Server 2012 / 2015
  • HTML / CSS
  • Microservices
  • MV* Javascript - Angular (8)
  • Experience with CI/CD
  • Azure
  • Test Driven
Interviews are taking place next week so APPLY NOW!

data.jobTitle: Software Data Engineer - Metadata / Python / React.js
data.contentHTML:
• Permanent opportunity
  • Located in the Sydney CBD
  • Work with a leading Data Engineering & Governance team

We have a new permanent opportunity available for a data enthusiast to join this data engineering team as a Software Data Engineer.

The role offers a lot of variety in terms of the day to day focus whereby you’ll be tasked with supporting the Data Governance teams to contribute towards the metadata strategies and enhance data governance across the organisation, involving ETL activities, data modelling, scripting (Python) along with some software development tasks across React.js and JavaScript.

Technically, this is a challenging role as it comprises both data governance and meta data disciplines along with a software development approach, so this role is ideally suited to a Software Engineer / Developer who has a strong background working in data disciplines.

Key focus of the role:
  • Identifying new sources of metadata and integrating them into the single strategic metadata management repository.
  • Develop metadata solutions that help safe guard the data assets whilst making them open and accessible to those with the appropriate access privileges.
  • Utilise DevOps skills to develop, schedule and deploy metadata scanners and connectors to extract, load and integrate technical and business metadata.
  • Refine the Metadata Management Strategy and co-own the associated delivery roadmap
  • Develop easy to use business metadata templates and associated import processes and off up suggestions to integrate those processes into BAU and huddles.
  • Adopt a continuous improvement approach with uplifting current state tools and technologies, implementing advanced Business Glossaries and automating key governance processes with metadata.
  • Develop workflows for business metadata collection such as for data stewardship functions as well as for escalation and exception management
  • Develop and enhance compelling User Interfaces in React.js / JavaScript.
Skills & experience that will propel your success in the role:
  • A proven background working across Metamodeling with data modelling experience.
  • SQL database administration with ETL development experience.
  • Experience working with PostgreSQL will be an added advantage for this role.
  • Linux and Windows administration experience.
  • Strong Development and scripting skills in Python.
  • Experience building UI interfaces across Front-End development using React, JavaScript.
  • Enthusiastic about working with data and enhancing data governance.
  • Collaborative communication skills to be able to engage with other technical teams and business stakeholders.
This is a rewarding permanent career opportunity to join a leading brand and work with a high performing data engineering team where you will pick up new skills and gain exposure to innovative data engineering solutions.

Responsibilities:

5+ years of experience in Frontend development, who can be a key contributor in the development team and expected to bring world class digital experiences in accordance with product requirements, designs, and user stories. Requires knowledge and experience towards front-end development and creating great user experiences.

Primary Skills:

  • 5+ years’ experience of Front-End development and 2+ years on React JS.
  • Minimum 2+ Years’ experience in ReactJS (Expert level).
  • Mobile Responsive (Expert Level).
  • 4+ years’ experience in CSS 3, SASS, HTML 5 – JSON.
  • Accessibility (Mid-Level).
  • Java Script, SASS and Web Package, API Integration, Typescript.

Secondary Skills:

  • CICD, Request, DOM.
  • SharePoint Online/Office 365 API usage.
  • Working with RESTful APIs, development and consumption.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment.
  • .Net, SQL Server (Good to have).

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent

data.contentHTML:
Our world is built by individuals who work every day in the trenches of harsh environments to ensure top-notch craftsmanship of world-class infrastructure for our commutes, our neighbourhoods, and our cities. At Assignar, our vision is to empower trade contractors around the world to help make a more efficient, safe, and quality world for the communities they build and the people they employ.

Assignar is a cloud based compliance, asset and workforce management platform. Developed from first hand experience and the need to solve the challenges within a fast growing construction service provider, Assignar rapidly gained interest from stakeholders in other industries facing similar challenges.

We have offices in Sydney and Denver. We are a team of over 60 and are venture-backed by some of the most well-respected investors in the US and Australia

About you

You are a product-minded engineer wanting to make a difference for our customers. You have a strong experience as a backend engineer and with databases. We expect our developers to contribute more than just code. You'll be involved in defining how things work, what they do, and why we do that instead of something else. We also expect you to share your knowledge and expertise with everyone else.

We use the following technologies in our back-end: AWS/Serverless, Django/Python, GraphQL, TypeScript/Node. Experience in all these particular technologies isn't a requirement for applying but you'll be using them on a regular basis.

Bonus point if you have strong experience in Django, Data Engineering, or another special and relevant skill that sets you apart! The two initial projects you will be working on are touching both of these domains.

Our culture

Do you enjoy working in a customer driven culture? We focus on understanding our customer's needs, delivering value in a lean agile way and celebrating when our customers are happy.

We have an inclusive and diverse culture with an emphasis on knowledge sharing, flexibility and bringing the best out of each other. Caring and showing empathy towards our customers and our colleagues is key to us. We take the time to understand their frustrations, what they want and need.

If you are someone who is interested in being part of an innovative environment or excited to learn cutting-edge technologies please feel free to reach out!

data.contentHTML:
Marlin Communications is a creative digital agency with a focus on unique, tailored solutions for each client. We’re a close-knit and agile team that loves producing beautiful, well-designed and meaningful digital experiences that work in the real world. Our vision is to create a world where all ideas can be brought to life. We believe in making a difference, working smarter before harder, that simple is beautiful and that we can make it happen.

We are looking for a developer programmer to join the team who is going to be a key part of our growth well into the future. We’re looking for a team player that wants to develop core components and lead development teams to deliver great outcomes. We value quick-thinking and a determined, focused attitude – someone who likes learning quickly and applies a smarter before harder approach. We work with a range of clients that need our skills, from nonprofits to enterprise and solve problems with technology, not the other way around.

Ultimately, we want a team member that believes in our team’s vision, to take ownership in that vision and to be an integral part of our team on the journey. We’re interested in a long-term relationship, and want to have someone on board who wants to build great things with us.

*Skills & Requirements
Reporting Lines:

You will report to the Head of Production and will work alongside technical and creative team members.
*
*
What we are looking for:

  • You have strong English skills (fluent)
  • You have 3+ years as a Full LAMP Stack Developer.
  • You are calm and collected under pressure.
  • You will be enthusiastic about opportunities to improve and adapt your skills as our business needs require.
  • You know what frameworks or technology to leverage for a project & why you would use them.
  • You have the ability to answer questions and help solve problems other developers encounter.
  • You are comfortable with writing complex MySQL/MariaDB queries.
  • You are comfortable with using a Linux command line.
  • You follow code standards to develop quality & maintainable code.

*
*
Your Major Responsibilities:

  • Lead projects on a technical level from concept through to delivery and deployment.
  • Software development on projects.
  • Translating project requirements into blocks of tasks for developers to work on.
  • Maintenance of the backlog of tasks & review of the developers’ progress.
  • Requirements analysis and technical design of the software solutions in collaboration with the development team.
  • Software quality assurance (audits, code reviews, testing, etc).
  • Carry out technical interviews with potential developers & partners.
  • Test and document software for client applications.
  • Write, modify, and debug software for client applications.
  • Write code to create single-threaded or user interface event driven applications, either stand-alone and those which access servers or services.
  • Use source debuggers and visual development environments.

The Key Skills Required Are:

  • Object-Oriented Programming
  • An Advanced Knowledge of
  • PHP (Laravel, WordPress)
  • Javascript
  • Relational Databases (MySQL)
  • Web Servers (Apache, NGINX)
  • Thorough understanding of HTTP request/response cycle, and SDLC development principles
  • Experience writing technical requirement documents and using version control (GIT)
  • API integration experience (Facebook, Twitter, Paypal etc.)

Salary Range

$70,000 - $100,000 annual package (inclusive of superannuation)

Performance Targets

Outlined below are some of your KPI’s for your first 12 months of employment with Marlin Communications. These are subject to change at any time by the employer, depending on business needs.

  • Successful delivery of the technical aspect of all Leafcutter projects, to leading quality standards
  • Reducing and maintaining a short response time to technical issues and time taken to fix
  • Development of technical standards that can be applied to all projects
  • Development of automated build & deployment processes including test cases

To Apply

If you are interested in the above position and you think you have what it takes for this exciting role please send your CV along with your salary expectations to the following email address katy @ marlincommunications.com.

Due to the high volume of applications we receive, only shortlisted candidates will be responded to.
*

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $70,000.00 to $100,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • PHP (Laravel, WordPress), Javascript: 3 years (Required)
  • Full LAMP Stack Developer: 3 years (Required)

Language:

  • English (Required)

data.contentHTML:
• Work with our client, a global leader in electronics
  • Receive competitive remuneration package and best in class training
  • Experience bright career prospects and opportunities

About Us

Cheil Australia delivers true integrated business solutions, with 53 offices operating in 43 countries worldwide with around 7,000 employees globally.

We brim with innovative ideas, which serve as the platform for solutions that can instantly send ripples through the market and make life happier and smarter. We are more than just a brand and Retail Ideas Company but a company that others aspire to be a part of us.

Your new Opportunity

In your role as Front-End Developer you will create amazing user experiences and work with a great team of strategists, operations and designers. This newly created role will play a pivotal role in the advancement of the agency’s e-commerce and digital marketing capabilities for our client, a Global leader in Consumer Electronics.

Reporting to the Digital Account Director, you’ll take a lead on website updates on AEM and Hybris, and the creation of digital advertising assets that will be seen all across Australia.

Experience in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), SAP Hybris, CSS, HTML5 and Javascript will be essential. Any experience with Google Tag Manager, Adobe Tag Manager, Adobe Target and Google Optimise will be highly regarded.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Develop secure, testing front end code for our client in the development of microsites
  • Proven experience with highly polished front end web development including large, complex websites
  • Extensive knowledge HTML / CSS / JavaScript (primarily HTML5, CSS3 & vanilla JavaScript6)
  • Experience Front End build tools and CSS pre-processors (SASS) Proven experience connecting back end systems/API interface to the front end site
  • Configure and develop Pages, and Page Templates, components, email templates and localisation.
  • Create static, video and HTML assets for a range of online and offline platforms including social media, display advertising, websites and mobile apps.
  • Create website assets from hero page takeovers to animations
  • Communicate and work alongside the project owner and designer to deliver the vision for end customers
  • Closely work with E-commerce Designers in the development of content

Qualifications

  • Tertiary qualification in FE Development or equivalent experience
  • Experience in Technology, eCommerce, Telecommunications, and Electronics highly regarded.

Skills and Experience

  • Minimum 4 years’ experience with responsive design and frontend development Excellent understanding of HTML5 and CSS standards
  • Proficient in cross-browser testing and debugging
  • Strong UX/UI design skills and application of web design best practices
  • Strong visual and user-focused design skills and able to recreate detailed designs
  • Have a passion for elegant code – Take pride in creating reusable, easy to read, concise code
  • Team player with good communication skills
  • You have high standards in everything that you do with great attention to detail
  • You optimize development for maximum speed and scalability
  • You solve problems, identify root causes and quickly resolve issues
  • You find opportunities, develop processes & guidelines supporting website stability, performance & cost management

Technical Knowledge of:

  • Adobe Experience Manager
  • SAP Hybris
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • Javascript

Experience with:

  • Google Tag Manager
  • Adobe Tag Manager

How you can join us

To be considered for this great opportunity, simply "Apply" NOW.

We thank you for your application and advise that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
